Question: I swore a vow to the Night's Watch. If I don't take my own word seriously, what sort of Lord of Winterfell would I be?
Answer: Crowded. You'd think we were serving venison stew.

Question: Does anyone wish to speak for candidates before we cast our tokens for the 998th Lord Commander of the Night's Watch?
Answer: Ser Alliser Thorne is not just a knight, he's a man of true nobility. He was acting commander when the Wall came under attack, and led us to victory against the wildlings.

Question: Is there anyone else?
Answer: Ser Denys Mallister joined the Watch as a boy and has served loyally longer than any other ranger. Through 10 winters he served. As commander of the Shadow Tower, he kept the wildlings away. We could do no better.

Question: Another wildling lover just like his friend Jon Snow. How's your lady love Slayer?
Answer: Her name is Gilly. Brother Slynt knows her quite well. They cowered together in the larder during the battle for the Wall.

Question: I can't argue with any of that. But who does Jon Snow want to command? Night's Watch or the wildlings? Everyone knows he loved a wildling girl and spoke with Mance Rayder many times. What would have happened in that tent between those two old friends if Stannis's army hadn't come along? We all saw him put the King-beyond-the-Wall out of his misery. Do you want to choose a man who has fought the wildlings all his life, or a man who makes love to them?
Answer: It is time.

Question: What have you got there?
Answer: I said--

Question: Who are you? Why were they scared of you?
Answer: You lost this.

Question: Well who are you then?
Answer: No one. And that is who a girl must become.

Question: Then who lives in the Pyramids? Who wears gold masks and murders your children? When Grey Worm came to us, I was the first to take up the knife for you. I remember the look on my father's face as I struck down his Master, who had traded his infant son for a dog. My father died in the fighting. If we allow the Sons of the Harpy to return us to chains, he never lived.
Answer: The Harpy's life was not yours to take. Once, the Masters were the law--

Question: No? Why come, then?
Answer: You said that I could be your apprentice. You said you'd teach me how to a Faceless Man.

Question: Which one is the Many-Faced God? I see the Stranger. I see the Drowned God. I see the Weirwood Face.
Answer: There is only one god. A girl knows his name. And all men know his gift.

Question: Where are they taking him?
Answer: Queen Margaery! Queen Margaery! Queen Margaery!

Question: Did I hurt you?
Answer: No. You were lovely.

Question: Wouldn't that be glorious? . Shouldn't we rest a little while? Just to catch our breath, there's no rush, is there?
Answer: Of course not. Are you hungry? Shall I have them bring you some cake or pomegranate juice?

Question: Of course not. Are you hungry? Shall I have them bring you some cake or pomegranate juice?
Answer: No, I'm fine. I just want you all to myself. I want to know everything there is to know about King Tommen First of His Name.

Question: King Tommen. It still sounds strange to me. Does Queen Margaery sound strange to you?
Answer: So strange… Husband.

Question: I understand. But it's not your fault, you know that, don't you? You mustn't feel guilty.
Answer: I don't feel guilty. That's what's odd.

Question: Do you like to sail?
Answer: I love to sail.

Question: Living in a tower so high, it touches the clouds. Of course my grandmother couldn't wait to go home. The capital is not for everyone, I suppose. Does your mother like it here?
Answer: I don't think so. She told me never to trust anyone in King's Landing.

Question: You look very much in love. The first days of marriage are often so blissful. She's certainly very pretty, isn't she? Like a doll, she smiles quite a lot. Do you think she's intelligent? I can't quite tell. Not that it matters.
Answer: Do you ever miss Casterly Rock?

Question: Do you ever miss Casterly Rock?
Answer: There's nothing for me in Casterly Rock.

Question: Why are we speaking of Casterly Rock?
Answer: The way that you talked about it, I always thought that you missed it. That you... That it was your real home.

Question: But wouldn't you be happier in Casterly Rock?
Answer: I said, "Darling, surely 4 times is enough, are you trying to set a new record?" . And he said, "Well, what is the record? I'm sure we can break it."

Question: I said, "Darling, surely 4 times is enough, are you trying to set a new record?" . And he said, "Well, what is the record? I'm sure we can break it."
Answer: Mother! . Welcome.

Question: Can we bring you anything to eat or drink? I wish we had some wine for you. It's a bit early in the day for us.
Answer: No, no. I, I can't stay. I just wanted to let you know if, there is ever anything I can do for you.

Question: Oh, forgive me, I haven't been at Court for long, I get so confused. What's the proper way to address you now? Queen Mother or Dowager Queen?
Answer: There's no need for such formalities.

Question: Can you imagine the celebrations? They'll ring the bells all day and night.
Answer: Remember. Anything you need.

Question: And?
Answer: The new Lord Cerwyn paid his taxes.

Question: We don't have enough men to hold the North if the other Houses rise up against us. Do you understand that?
Answer: Our pact with the Lannisters protects -

Question: Yes. A bit shabby, isn't it? You've been here before.
Answer: On our way down to King's Landing, with my father and Arya and… where are you taking me?

Question: On our way down to King's Landing, with my father and Arya and… where are you taking me?
Answer: Home.

Question: The Boltons have Winterfell. . The marriage proposal, it wasn't for you?
Answer: No.

Question: I won't force you to do anything. Don't you know by now how much I care for you? Say the word and we turn the horses round, but listen to me. Listen. . You've been running all your life. Terrible things happened to your family and you weep. You sit alone in a darkened room, mourning their fates. You've been a bystander to tragedy from the day they executed your father. Stop being a bystander, do you hear me? Stop running. There's no justice in the world. Not unless we make it. You loved your family. Avenge them.
Answer: How do we get through there?

Question: How do we get through there?
Answer: We don't. We go around. .

Question: Aren't you getting a bit old to be a squire? How did you end up squiring for the Imp?
Answer: He hates that nickname.

Question: Well, he's not here to complain about it, is he?
Answer: I squired for a knight name Ser Lorimer during the War of the Five Kings. One night, he had a bit too much to drink. And he was famished, so he borrowed a ham.

Question: He borrowed it?
Answer: He wasn't a thief. He was drunk and hungry and he wasn't thinking. I was drunk too. He gave me half the ham. Next morning, one of the guards saw him passed out, under a wagon, with the ham bone still in his hand. They hanged the man afternoon. They tied the noose for me too, but, Lord Tywin heard my family name was Payne. So he pardoned me, and sent me to King's Landing to squire for his son.

Question: You want to be a knight, Pod?
Answer: Yes.

Question: You weren't a knight, but you were a Kingsguard to Renly Baratheon, weren't you?
Answer: I was.

Question: But how did you end up serving Renly?
Answer: When I was a girl, my father held a ball. I'm his only living child, so he wants to make a good match for me. He invited dozens of young lords to Tarth. I didn't want to go, but he dragged me to the ballroom. . And it was wonderful. None of the boys noticed how mulish and tall I was. The shoved each other, and threatened to duel if they thought it was their turn to dance. And whispered in my ear how they wanted to marry me and take me back to their castles. . My father smiled at me and I smiled at him. I'd never been so happy. . Till I saw a few of the boys sniggering. And then they all started to laugh, they couldn't keep the game going any longer. They were toying with me. ‘Brienne the Beauty', they called me. Great joke. And I realized I was the ugliest girl alive. A great lumbering beast. I tried to run away, but Renly Baratheon took me in his arms. “Don't let them see your tears,” he told me. “They're nasty little shits. The nasty little shits aren't worth crying over.” He danced with me and none of the other boys could say a word. And he was the king's brother after all.

Question: But you said a shadow murdered him. How do you fight a shadow?
Answer: A shadow with the face of Stannis Baratheon. I know it was Stannis. I know it in my heart. Stannis is a man, not a shadow. And a man can be killed.

Question: Very well. . Have you considered my offer?
Answer: I have. And I thank you for it. You do me great honor. All my life I wanted to be Jon Stark.

Question: May I ask, Your Grace, how long you plan to stay at Castle Black?
Answer: Are you bored of us already?

Question: Are you bored of us already?
Answer: You saved us from Mance Rayder's army. We will never forget that. But it's a question of survival. The Night's Watch can't continue to feed your men and the wildling prisoners indefinitely. Winter is coming.

Question: And the wildlings?
Answer: They'd rather burn than fight for me, so be it. I leave their fate to you. You could execute them, that's the safest course. . Or you could see if this Tormund fellow is more willing to compromise than Mance ever was. I assume the brothers of the Night's Watch would rather see the wildlings dead.

Question: You have many enemies in Castle Black. Have you considered sending Alliser Thorne elsewhere? Give him command of Eastwatch-by-the-Sea.
Answer: I heard it was best to keep your enemies close.

Question: Have you now? . How does the Night's Watch vow go again? I bet you've got it memorized since you got here.
Answer: Night gathers and now my watch begins -

Question: And what needs to be done?
Answer: As long as the Boltons rule the North, , the North will suffer. Just one man's opinion.

Question: What do you want?
Answer: Who are you?

Question: Who are you?
Answer: What?

Question: What?
Answer: You, who walk in here with a coin you never earned, whose value you do not respect. . Who are you?

Question: You, who walk in here with a coin you never earned, whose value you do not respect. . Who are you?
Answer: No one.

Question: A lie, a sad little lie. Who are you?
Answer: I told you, I'm no - . Do that again and -

Question: What are you doing?
Answer: We were only playing. The game of faces.

Question: For what? For whatever you want. To be a Faceless Man. To be no one.
Answer: Whose sword is that? It belongs to Arya Stark. Arya Stark's sword, Arya Stark's clothes, Arya Stark's stolen silver. A man wonders how is it that no one came to be surrounded by Arya Stark's things?

Question: Whose sword is that? It belongs to Arya Stark. Arya Stark's sword, Arya Stark's clothes, Arya Stark's stolen silver. A man wonders how is it that no one came to be surrounded by Arya Stark's things?
Answer: What do we do with them after we wash them?

Question: What do we do with them after we wash them?
Answer: Open gates!

Question: May I introduce my son, , Ramsay Bolton?
Answer: It's an honor to meet you, my Lady.

Question: Sam. . Maester Aemon?
Answer: He apologizes for not being here. He's not feeling well.

Question: I will not go meekly off to freeze and die! Give it to one of the fools who cast a stone for you. I will not have it. Do you hear me, boy? I will not have it!
Answer: Are you refusing to obey my order?

Question: Are you refusing to obey my order?
Answer: You can stick your order up your bastard arse.

Question: Which of the Seven will you worship today?
Answer: The Maiden.

Question: Where is the Maiden?
Answer: And the Stranger.

Question: Two is extra, you realize?
Answer: Yes, yes.

Question: What are you doing? This establishment belong to Lord Petyr Baelish. You can't -
Answer: You have profaned our faith. The faith of our fathers and forefathers.

Question: You were assaulted?
Answer: I was, by those fanatics who call themselves ‘sparrows'. They humiliated me, they they beat me, they left me naked and bleeding on the cobblestones. I am lucky to be alive.

Question: So you were administering to the needs of these devout prostitutes?
Answer: A man's private affairs ought to stay private!

Question: What do you want from us, High Septon?
Answer: Justice! I ask that you protect our Faith by arresting these criminals and throwing them in the black cells. I ask that you execute their leader, this so-called High Sparrow. He's a threat to everything we hold sacred. If he goes unpunished -

Question: And where do I find this man? This High Sparrow?
Answer: I don't think this is a good idea, Your Grace.

Question: Nonsense, Ser Meryn. These are deeply religious people. . Where can I find the High Sparrow?
Answer: Seven blessings.

Question: A young man said I would find the High Sparrow back here. Where is he?
Answer: High Sparrow? Sounds ridiculous, doesn't it? Like Lord Duckling, or King Turtle. . So, it's meant to. We're often stuck with the names our enemies give to us. . The notion that we are all equal in the eyes of Seven doesn't sit well with some, so they belittle me.

Question: High Sparrow? Sounds ridiculous, doesn't it? Like Lord Duckling, or King Turtle. . So, it's meant to. We're often stuck with the names our enemies give to us. . The notion that we are all equal in the eyes of Seven doesn't sit well with some, so they belittle me.
Answer: Seven blessings to you.

Question: Why no shoes?
Answer: Because I gave them away to someone who needed them more. We all do that. It stops us from forgetting what we really are.

Question: Is that why you came to King's Landing? To remind everyone?
Answer: Everyone? I have a hard enough job reminding myself. Oh, I tell them no one's special. And they think I'm special for telling them so.

Question: Everyone? I have a hard enough job reminding myself. Oh, I tell them no one's special. And they think I'm special for telling them so.
Answer: Perhaps they're right.

Question: It would be comforting to believe that, wouldn't it? The Gods sent you here to tempt me? I hope not. I had assumed you'd only come here to arrest me. For that incident with the High Septon.
Answer: An unacceptable way to treat the chosen representative of the Gods in this world, wouldn't you say?

Question: An unacceptable way to treat the chosen representative of the Gods in this world, wouldn't you say?
Answer: Hypocrisy is a boil. Lancing a is never pleasant. Although, they could have been more careful with the blade.

Question: How's your work coming along?
Answer: Very well.

Question: You've made progress?
Answer: More than I've expected. Still a way to go, but…

Question: Shouldn't he be?
Answer: I assure you she's still a virgin. Tyrion never consummated the marriage. By the law of the land, she's no man's wife. Inspect her, if you must.

Question: I'm sure you understand my position, Lord Baelish. If you received word in the night from the Queen Mother, it does make me question our new alliance. The Lannisters made you one of the great lords of Westeros. Yet, here you are in the North, undermining them. Why gamble with your position?
Answer: Every ambitious move is a gamble. You gambled when you drove a dagger into Robb Stark's heart. It appears that your gamble paid off. You're Warden of the North.

Question: I had Tywin Lannister backing. Who supports me now? You?
Answer: The Eyrie is mine. The last time the lords of the Eyrie formed an alliance with the lords of the North, they brought down the greatest dynasty this world has ever known. I'd like to borrow one of your birds. Cersei will expect a reply.

Question: Look, we are thousands of miles from Westeros. . What am I? . One more drunk dwarf.
Answer: Slaves.

Question: We're going to meet the Saviour! You should have told me. Who doesn't want to meet the Saviour?
Answer: Come on. Let's find a brothel.

Question: See? We blend right in. Just two more travellers, mad with lust.
Answer: Thank you.

Question: What makes you worth that much?
Answer: I'm magic. .

Question: Where're you going?
Answer: I need to speak to someone with hair.

Question: Hello?
Answer: Hello.

Question: Do I look like a man without money? . Never trust looks. Until quite recently, I was one of the richest men in the world. . But who needs wealth when you can make a woman laugh? . I always pay my debts, I'm well known for it.
Answer: You like her? They all like her. They all want to fuck a queen.

Question: You like her? They all like her. They all want to fuck a queen.
Answer: That's because they've never met a queen.

Question: Why?
Answer: Because you have a skeptical mind.

Question: Gladly, but this, I can't do. Believe me, no one is more shocked than I am. I hope it passes. What will I do in my spare time? I'll go for a piss, that's a start.
Answer: No need to worry, I was just - . Oh, I thought you were someone else. Shows almost over. I'm sure the girls inside will be happy to oblige.

Question: Is that Estermont?
Answer: Tarth, Ser Jaime. . The Sapphire Isle.

Question: Why are we on a merchant ship? Why no Lannister sails?
Answer: This ship's sailing to Oldtown. We'll get off earlier, not far from Sunspear. Row ourselves to the Dornish shores in the night.

Question: You ever been to Dorne?
Answer: No.

Question: Your niece?
Answer: I've been doing this sort of thing a long time. I'm good at it. .

Question: I know. Why are you here? Why not send 40 of me, or an army? Unlike most folks, you actually got one.
Answer: Because I don't want to start a war.

Question: You set your brother free, didn't you? I bet your sister didn't like that.
Answer: Varys set him free.

Question: How much can the Crown afford?
Answer: With winter coming, half what they ask. Less.

Question: You're the Master of Coin. How do we pay them?
Answer: Well, House Tyrell could front the gold, and the the Crown will pay us back in time, or I'll have words with my daughter.

Question: Me? .
Answer: We must send an envoy to the Iron Bank, someone of importance, to show these bankers our respect. As the King's Master of Coin, I can think of no one more qualified.

Question: My very own Kingsguard? Please express -
Answer: Safe travels, Lord Tyrell.

Question: May I offer you some wine, Your Holiness?
Answer: No. .

Question: How may I serve?
Answer: All over Westeros we hear about septs being burned. Silent sisters raped. Bodies of holy men piled in the streets.

Question: What would you say if I told you we have a great sinner in our very midst? Shielded by gold and privilege.
Answer: May the Father judge him justly. .

Question: Who do you think you are?
Answer: Justice. .

Question: Why is my brother in a cell?
Answer: I, I don't know. I, I didn't order it.

Question: Are you saying my mother is behind this?
Answer: She's jealous you're not hers anymore. Arresting my brother is her revenge.

Question: Aren't you and mother getting along?
Answer: Oh, my sweet, sweet King. . Do you have any affection for me at all?

Question: Oh, my sweet, sweet King. . Do you have any affection for me at all?
Answer: Of course I do. You're my Queen.

Question: Do you promise?
Answer: I demand that Ser Loras be freed now!

Question: Did I arrest him?
Answer: Well, no... But you armed the Faith Militant. You gave the High Sparrow an army.

Question: Then can I tell Margaery you'll have Ser Loras released?
Answer: I told you I am not holding Ser Loras. You're the King. I'm sure if you speak to the High Sparrow, he'll release the poor boy.

Question: You mean, kill them? Here, in the sept?
Answer: You'll be sending them to meet the Gods that they love.

Question: My Queen?
Answer: There was no way to free Ser Loras without violence.

Question: Are you? When?
Answer: I--I don't know.

Question: You don't know?
Answer: He was praying just now.

Question: Will you come back later? .
Answer: I need to be with my family, Your Grace. .

Question: Whose then? . I gave you nothing but weakness. . And deformity. .
Answer: Those scars mean nothing to the Lord of Light.

Question: You march on Winterfell soon?
Answer: We must. To beat the snows.

Question: And you, my Lady, what do you need?
Answer: To serve my Lord.

Question: And how many men does this Lord Mazin have to send us?
Answer: More than Lord Wibberley.

Question: How can I help you?
Answer: Come with us when we ride south. . None of us know the castle as well as you do. Its hidden tunnels, its weaknesses, its people. Winterfell was your home once. Don't you want to chase the rats out of it? .

Question: Come with us when we ride south. . None of us know the castle as well as you do. Its hidden tunnels, its weaknesses, its people. Winterfell was your home once. Don't you want to chase the rats out of it? .
Answer: Castle Black is my home now. Night's Watch takes no part in the wars of the Seven Kingdoms.

Question: Do you feel my heart beating? This power in you, you resist it, and that's your mistake. Embrace it.
Answer: The Lord of Light made us male and female. Two parts of a greater whole. We are joining this power. Power to make life, power to make light, and power to cast shadows.

Question: Why?
Answer: I swore a vow. . I loved another.

Question: Are you lonely?
Answer: Just bored.

Question: Were you bored a lot, too?
Answer: I know Castle Black is no place for a child, but I -

Question: Why do you say that?
Answer: She told me, "I don't want to bring you."

Question: Are you ashamed of me, father?
Answer: When you were an infant, , the Dornish trailer landed on Dragonstone. His goods were junk except for one wooden doll. He'd even sewn a dress on it in the colors of our House. No doubt he'd heard of your birth, and assumed new fathers were easy targets. I still remember how you smiled when I put that doll in your cradle, , and you pressed it to your cheek. . By the time we burnt the doll, it was too late. . I was told you would die. Or worse, the grayscale would go slow. . Let you grow just enough to know the world before taking it away from you. Everyone advised me to send you to the ruins of Valyria to live out your short life with the Stone men, before the sickness spread to the castle. I told them all to go to hell. . I called in every maester on this side of the world. Every healer, every apothecary. They stopped the disease and saved your life. Because you did not belong across the world with the bloody Stone men. . You are the Princess Shireen of House Baratheon. And you are my daughter.

Question: I saw her once. I was a boy, living with your mother's family. Lord Whent had a great tourney at Harrenhal. Everyone was there. The Mad King, your father, Robert Baratheon. And Lyanna, she was already promised to Robert. You can imagine what it was like for me, a boy from nowhere, with nothing to his name, watching these legendary men, tilting at the lists. The last two riders were Barristan Selmy and Rhaegar Targaryen. When Rhaegar won, everyone cheered for the prince. I remember the girls laughing when he took off his helmet and they saw that silver hair. How handsome he was. Until he rode right past his wife, Elia Martell, and all the smiles died. I've never seen so many people so quiet. He rode past his wife, and he lay a crown of winter roses in Lyanna's lap. Blue as frost. How many tens of thousands had to die because Rhaegar chose your aunt?
Answer: Yes, he chose her… and then he kidnapped her and raped her.

Question: Dressed for riding?
Answer: I am.

Question: Where are you going?
Answer: King's Landing.

Question: King's Landing?
Answer: Cersei sent for me. . We must not let her sniff out any trouble.

Question: How do you know?
Answer: Stannis Baratheon garrisons at Castle Black. He'll march south to King's Landing before the winter snows block his way. But first, he has to take Winterfell.

Question: You think he'll defeat the Boltons?
Answer: He has a larger army. He's the finest military commander in Westeros. A betting man would put his money on Stannis. . As it happens, I am a betting man.

Question: And if you're right?
Answer: Stannis takes Winterfell, he rescues you from the most despised family in the North. Grateful for your late father's courageous support for his claim, he names you Wardeness of the North.

Question: What if you're wrong? What if Stannis never attacks Winterfell, or he does and the Boltons defeat him?
Answer: Then you will take this Bolton boy, Ramsay, and make him yours.

Question: He should, he's a dangerous man. But even the most dangerous men can be outmaneuvered. And you've learnt to maneuver from the very best. . I return before too long. . You'll be strong without me. . The North will be yours. Do you believe me?
Answer: I expect I'll be a married woman by the time you return.

Question: No? Two knights, off to rescue a princess. Sounds like a good song to me.
Answer: Sounds like all the rest.

Question: What about you? What shit way would you choose?
Answer: In my own keep, drinking my own wine, watching my sons grovel for my fortune.

Question: I've had an exciting life. I want my death to be boring. How do you want to go?
Answer: In the arms of the woman I love.

Question: She want the same thing?
Answer: Let's go.

Question: The captain to that ship… What was he, Braavosi?
Answer: Pentoshi.

Question: And he's headed to Oldtown?
Answer: As I said. Why?

Question: As I said. Why?
Answer: What's to stop him from docking down the coast and telling the locals that Jaime Lannister's in Dorne?

Question: What's to stop him from docking down the coast and telling the locals that Jaime Lannister's in Dorne?
Answer: A bag of gold.

Question: How many you count?
Answer: Four.

Question: How many you think you can take?
Answer: One, if he's slow.

Question: Who are you?
Answer: Cooper. . This is Darnell.

Question: Accent gave me away? Flea Bottom. Whelped and whipped.
Answer: Why are you here?

Question: Why are you here?
Answer: Our ship capsized in the night. We managed to swim ashore. It was a near thing, really.

Question: Do you know how long it will take us to dig all those holes?
Answer: I can't dig very well with one hand. Not at all, really.

Question: Will it be war?
Answer: Prince Doran will weep for your father, but nothing else. We must avenge Oberyn ourselves.

Question: Nym? . Obara?
Answer: When I was a child, , Oberyn came to take me to court. I'd never seen this man, and yet he called himself my father. My mother wept, said I was too young, and a girl.

Question: Thank you. . Who are you?
Answer: Your captor.

Question: Do you have wine?
Answer: No.

Question: What business would you have with the Queen?
Answer: Gold and glory. Oh, and hate. If you've ever met my sister, you'd understand. So now that it's clear we're on the same side? . A high born knight from the North of Westeros, down on his luck in Essos. Dragon epaulettes? Bear sigil breast plate. You're Jorah Mormont. I have to ask how, exactly, were you serving your Queen in a whore house, half a world away? Is it possible, that you were running? Why would you be running? And why would she have sent you away? Oh, wait! You were spying on her, weren't you? It's all coming back to me! I was drunk through most of the Small Council meetings, but it's all coming back. You passed notes to Varys's little birds. She found out, didn't she? Found out, and exiled you. . And now you hope to win back her favor with a gift. A risky scheme. One might even say, desperate. Do you think Daenerys would execute me, and pardon you? I'd say the reverse is just as likely.

Question: Gold and glory. Oh, and hate. If you've ever met my sister, you'd understand. So now that it's clear we're on the same side? . A high born knight from the North of Westeros, down on his luck in Essos. Dragon epaulettes? Bear sigil breast plate. You're Jorah Mormont. I have to ask how, exactly, were you serving your Queen in a whore house, half a world away? Is it possible, that you were running? Why would you be running? And why would she have sent you away? Oh, wait! You were spying on her, weren't you? It's all coming back to me! I was drunk through most of the Small Council meetings, but it's all coming back. You passed notes to Varys's little birds. She found out, didn't she? Found out, and exiled you. . And now you hope to win back her favor with a gift. A risky scheme. One might even say, desperate. Do you think Daenerys would execute me, and pardon you? I'd say the reverse is just as likely.
Answer: Everyone looks happy enough from up here. . What?

Question: Everyone looks happy enough from up here. . What?
Answer: I was thinking of all the times your brother made me go with him down from the Red Keep, into the streets of King's Landing.

Question: Why?
Answer: He liked to walk among the people, he liked to sing to them.

Question: He sang to them?
Answer: Yes. Rhaegar would take a spot on the Hook or the Street of Seeds and then he'd sing. Just like all the other minstrels.

Question: And what did you do?
Answer: I made sure no one killed him. And I collected the money. . Well he liked to see how much he could make.

Question: He was good?
Answer: He was very good. Viserys never told you?

Question: He was very good. Viserys never told you?
Answer: He told me Rhaegar was good at killing people. .

Question: And what did you do with the money?
Answer: Well, one time, he gave it to the next minstrel down the street. One time, he gave it to an orphanage in Flea Bottom. One time... we got horribly drunk. .

Question: How many others are there?
Answer: Fifty a hundred.

Question: Will you be joining us, Ser Barristan?
Answer: I think I can protect you from Hizdahr Zo Loraq.

Question: Glory?
Answer: Why else do men fight? Why did your ancestors cross the Narrow Sea and conquer the Seven Kingdoms? So their names would live on. Those who find victory in the fighting pits, will never become kings, but their names will live on. It's the best chance they'll ever have.

Question: Why else do men fight? Why did your ancestors cross the Narrow Sea and conquer the Seven Kingdoms? So their names would live on. Those who find victory in the fighting pits, will never become kings, but their names will live on. It's the best chance they'll ever have.
Answer: Is that what you used to tell men before you set them to butchering each other for sport?

Question: Is that what you used to tell men before you set them to butchering each other for sport?
Answer: Your Grace, today is the traditional start of the fighting season.

Question: Who is innocent? Maybe all of you are, , maybe none of you are. Maybe, , I should let the dragons decide.
Answer: All men must die.

Question: How are you feeling?
Answer: Oh, like a hundred-year-old man slowly freezing to death.

Question: Where are the rest of the free folk now? . Where have they gone? . Who leads them?
Answer: They followed Mance. They won't follow anyone else.

Question: What about you?
Answer: Hard to lead when you're in chains.

Question: What if I unchained you?
Answer: Why would you do that?

Question: Why would you do that?
Answer: Because you are not my enemy. And I'm not yours.

Question: And now everything is going to change?
Answer: It is.

Question: Why now?
Answer: Because now, , I am Lord Commander of the Night's Watch.

Question: What would you have me do, , Lord Commander?
Answer: I'd have you go north of the Wall. Gather the remaining free folk wherever they are and bring them back here. I'll open the gates for them and let them through. I'll find them lands to settle south of the Wall.

Question: And how many of your people can't fight? The women, the children, the old, the sick, what happens to them? You're condemning them to death. Worse than death because you're too proud to make peace. Or maybe you're not proud. Maybe you're just a coward.
Answer: Easy thing to say to a man in chains.

Question: Most of them are at Hardhome. You know where that is?
Answer: Up on Storroldo s Point. I can give you 10 horses and nine other men. You can get there in a week.

Question: You'd bring wildlings here, through our gates?
Answer: Men, women, and children will die by the thousands if we do nothing.

Question: What?
Answer: Nothing.

Question: And why do you think the farmers abandoned those villages? Because the wildlings raided them for years. Cut them down! Just like they did this boy's people.
Answer: We've been fighting them all for thousands of years. They've slaughtered villages. They've slaughtered our brothers.

Question: You don't mean it, do you? Telling the wildlings you want to make peace. You're just doing it to trick them.
Answer: It's not a trick.

Question: Will there be anything else you need, Lord Commander?
Answer: No.

Question: Better off with the Boltons who murdered her mother and brother? Sansa's in danger even if she doesn't realize it.
Answer: Thank you. You've lived here a long time?

Question: Thank you. You've lived here a long time?
Answer: Aye.

Question: Did you know Lord Eddard?
Answer: I knew him and his father before him. The Starks are gone now.

Question: Who are you?
Answer: Someone who swore to keep her safe.

Question: Swore to who?
Answer: Her mother.

Question: That doesn't release me from an oath. I served Lady Catelyn. I serve her still. Who do you serve?
Answer: Come back here. Myranda.

Question: Do you think she's pretty?
Answer: Of course I do. I'm not blind.

Question: You're the kennel master's daughter. Who are you going to marry, the stable keeper's son? . You're mine. You're not going anywhere. Unless I have to listen to more of your jealousy. Jealousy bores me. You remember what happens to people who bore me. You're not going to bore me, are you, Myranda?
Answer: Never.

Question: I like your dress. Who made it for you?
Answer: I made it myself.

Question: Really?
Answer: Who, who are you?

Question: Who, who are you?
Answer: I'm Myranda, the kennel master's daughter. May I? . Oh, wonderful. The stitching. Who taught you?

Question: I'm Myranda, the kennel master's daughter. May I? . Oh, wonderful. The stitching. Who taught you?
Answer: My mother. .

Question: What is it?
Answer: That would spoil the surprise. Go ahead, it's perfectly safe. You won't believe it when you see it.

Question: Theon?
Answer: You shouldn't be here.

Question: Do you have something to tell me?
Answer: No, my lord.

Question: Who?
Answer: Sansa. Lady Sansa. She came to the kennels.

Question: She saw you?
Answer: Yes. I'm sorry, master. Forgive me. I didn't think -

Question: I heard you two had reunited. A fitting place for it. . I like to imagine that the last time you spoke was in this very room. Are you still angry with him after he - what he did? Don't worry. The North remembers. I punished him for it. He's not ironborn anymore. Not Theon Greyjoy anymore. He's a new man. A new person, anyway. Aren't you, Reek?
Answer: Yes, master.

Question: Why are you doing this?
Answer: Because Reek has something to say to you. Don't you, Reek? . An apology. Apologize to Lady Sansa for what you did. Apologize for murdering her two brothers.

Question: Because Reek has something to say to you. Don't you, Reek? . An apology. Apologize to Lady Sansa for what you did. Apologize for murdering her two brothers.
Answer: I'm sorry.

Question: Sorry about what?
Answer: For killing your brothers.

Question: There, over and done with. Doesn't everyone feel better? I do. That was getting very tense. Whew. . You know what, my lady? What with him having murdered your brothers and the rest of your family gone Reek here is the nearest thing to living kin that you have left. Reek. You will give away the bride. Someone has to. What better person? Good? Good?
Answer: Yes, yes, very good.

Question: How can you be sure?
Answer: Sure of what?

Question: Sure of what?
Answer: That she's pregnant. I mean how can you tell?

Question: That she's pregnant. I mean how can you tell?
Answer: Maester Wolkan has assured us beyond all doubt.

Question: So how did you manage it?
Answer: Manage what?

Question: Manage what?
Answer: Getting her pregnant.

Question: Of course, but how did you find it?
Answer: You disgraced yourself at dinner, parading that creature before the Stark girl.

Question: And if it's a boy?
Answer: You're worried about your position.

Question: Why would I? She had me, she died. And here we are.
Answer: She was a peasant girl. Pretty in a common sort of way. She was the miller's wife. Apparently they had married without my knowledge or consent. So I had him hanged and I took her beneath the tree where he was swaying. She fought me the whole time. She was lucky I didn't hang her, too. A year later she came to my gates with a squalling baby in her arms. A baby she claimed was mine. I nearly had her whipped and the child thrown in the river. . But then I looked at you and I saw then what I see now. You are my son. . Stannis Baratheon has an army at Castle Black. But he won't stay for long. He wants the Iron Throne, and the road to King's Landing comes right through Winterfell. He means to take the North. But the North is ours. It's yours and mine. Will you help me defeat him?

Question: She was a peasant girl. Pretty in a common sort of way. She was the miller's wife. Apparently they had married without my knowledge or consent. So I had him hanged and I took her beneath the tree where he was swaying. She fought me the whole time. She was lucky I didn't hang her, too. A year later she came to my gates with a squalling baby in her arms. A baby she claimed was mine. I nearly had her whipped and the child thrown in the river. . But then I looked at you and I saw then what I see now. You are my son. . Stannis Baratheon has an army at Castle Black. But he won't stay for long. He wants the Iron Throne, and the road to King's Landing comes right through Winterfell. He means to take the North. But the North is ours. It's yours and mine. Will you help me defeat him?
Answer: Yes.

Question: Is this every book there is?
Answer: Every book there is?

Question: Every book there is?
Answer: In the world.

Question: Where you grew up, were there more books?
Answer: My father's not the most literate man. They say the Citadel has the largest library in the world.

Question: Where's that?
Answer: The Citadel? In Oldtown.

Question: The Citadel? In Oldtown.
Answer: I'm sorry I don't know things.

Question: Why does the Citadel have the biggest library?
Answer: It's where they train the maesters.

Question: Like Maester Aemon?
Answer: I wanted to be one when I was young. Instead, I became a man of the Night's Watch. Far more adventure up here anyway. I wouldn't have met you.

Question: You're Samwell Tarly?
Answer: I am, Your Grace.

Question: How?
Answer: With a dagger made of dragonglass.

Question: Dragonglass?
Answer: What the maesters call obsidian -

Question: I know what it is. We have it in Dragonstone. Why would obsidian kill a walker?
Answer: I don't know. I've been going through all the old manuscripts hoping to find something, and all I've learned is that the children of the forest used to hunt with dragonglass.

Question: Seen what?
Answer: The army of the dead. And when they come -

Question: Uh, Your Grace. Wouldn't it be better to wait? When Jon Snow returns with the wildlings, we could have thousands more men.
Answer: If Jon Snow returns with the wildlings. We can't wait that long. We have the advantage, more men, more horses, all fed and rested. But every day we wait, the odds shift in Bolton's favor. This could turn to winter at any moment. We have to act now. Give the order. We march at sunrise.

Question: Here? Half these watchmen are killers and rapists. No, they march with us.
Answer: As you wish, Your Grace.

Question: Do you think Father will let me go down into the crypt?
Answer: Beg your pardon?

Question: Beg your pardon?
Answer: At Winterfell. All the Kings in the North are buried there. Bran the Builder and King Dorren and-

Question: Is there going to be a battle?
Answer: Aye, princess, but you won't be anywhere near -

Question: How long have I been here?
Answer: Three days.

Question: Ser Barristan?
Answer: I failed him. I failed my men, I failed my queen.

Question: You failed no one. You fought bravely. You'll fight again. Are you ashamed? You were ambushed, outnumbered. There was no way you could have known.
Answer: This is not why. Wounded in war, there is no shame for this. I am ashamed because when the knife go in and I fall to the ground, I am afraid.

Question: If I give everyone what they deserve, I'll have no one left to rule. Ser Barristan counseled mercy when I took this city right up to the morning he died. Daario Naharis thinks I should kill the former Masters and let the rest of the city fend for itself. What do you think?
Answer: Your Grace, I think that I am not fit to have an opinion on these matters.

Question: You are as fit as anyone I know. You know why I'm here. And you know who will suffer the most if this all falls apart. So what do you think?
Answer: I can only tell you what I have seen, Your Grace. . I have seen you listen to your counselors. I have seen you lean on their experience when your own was lacking and weigh the choices they put before you. And I have seen you ignore your counselors, because there was a better choice. One that only you could see.

Question: What about "Valar Morghulis"?
Answer: I did not want to die a coward. Apparently I do not want to die at all. .

Question: Don't worry. I'll be fine. Nothing broken, I don't think. Where are we now? Not the Rhoyne. . Long, sullen silences and an occasional punch in the face. The Mormont way. Let's start over. I apologize for before. My mouth sometimes runs away from me. This doesn't have to be an unpleasant trip. We're going to be spending a lot of time together on the way to Meereen.
Answer: We are.

Question: Have you sailed this route before?
Answer: No.

Question: You're going to bring Daenerys a souvenir from her ancestral homeland in case I'm not enough?
Answer: I think you'll be plenty.

Question: You know what they say. The Doom still rules Valyria. What about the demons and the flames? Aren't you afraid of the Doom?
Answer: No. But the pirates are.

Question: The Smoking Sea. How many centuries before we learn how to build cities like this again? Thousands of years the Valyrians were the best in the world at almost everything. And then -
Answer: And then they weren't.

Question: What was that?
Answer: Stone Men! Don't let them touch you!

Question: Tyrion? Tyrion. Tyrion. Tyrion. You're all right.
Answer: You're heavier than you look. Did any of them touch you?

Question: You're heavier than you look. Did any of them touch you?
Answer: You? . I've seen greyscale before, but nothing like that.

Question: You? . I've seen greyscale before, but nothing like that.
Answer: I suppose that's why they send them there.

Question: It'd be kinder to put daggers in their hearts and be done with it. . Thank you for saving me. Of course, I wouldn't have needed saving if you hadn't kidnapped me in the first place. . So what now?
Answer: We walk, up the coast. With luck, we'll find a fishing village. Maybe another boat.

Question: Without luck?
Answer: We've got a long walk ahead of us. I'll get some wood for a fire. Try to get some rest, huh?

Question: We've got a long walk ahead of us. I'll get some wood for a fire. Try to get some rest, huh?
Answer: That's the best idea you've had all day.

Question: What are they doing with the bodies?
Answer: Get back to work.

Question: When?
Answer: When it's time. Not before. Get back to work.

Question: When do I get to play the game?
Answer: Game?

Question: Game?
Answer: The game. The game of faces.

Question: Who are you?
Answer: No one.

Question: Well who are you? What are you doing here? How'd you get here?
Answer: I'm from Westeros. Just like you. Daughter of a Lord. Just like you. Except I was an only child. Heir to his fortune. My mother died. My father remarried and his new wife gave birth to a girl. My stepmother didn't want any rivals for her precious daughter so she tried to kill me with poison. I found out, sought help from the Faceless Men and my father was widowed again. I've been serving them ever since.

Question: Was that true or a lie?
Answer: What?

Question: What?
Answer: Did you believe every word I said?

Question: Did you believe every word I said?
Answer: Who are you?

Question: Who are you?
Answer: Arya.

Question: And where did you come from?
Answer: Westeros. My family home is Winterfell. I'm the youngest daughter of a great lord. Eddard Stark. He died in battle.

Question: The girl lies. To me. To the Many Faced God. To herself. Does she truly want to be no one?
Answer: Yes.

Question: You're not hungry?
Answer: Of course I'm hungry.

Question: You're an awful travelling companion, do you know that? Possibly the least charming man I have ever met.
Answer: I am not your travelling companion.

Question: Do you ever shut up?
Answer: I sailed from King's Landing to Pentos in a crate. Without ever saying a word.

Question: Why?
Answer: Never occurred to you to ask why until now? You never wondered why Tyrion Lannister decided to visit a brothel in Volantis.

Question: Never occurred to you to ask why until now? You never wondered why Tyrion Lannister decided to visit a brothel in Volantis.
Answer: I'm sure you've visited many brothels in many cities.

Question: What do you know about my father?
Answer: I met him. I visited the Wall. When I asked him about his men he knew all the stories, every one of them. He actually cared about the people in his command. How did they put it in the Watch? “We shall never see his like again.”

Question: I met him. I visited the Wall. When I asked him about his men he knew all the stories, every one of them. He actually cared about the people in his command. How did they put it in the Watch? “We shall never see his like again.”
Answer: You didn't know. I'm sorry. I am.

Question: How?
Answer: I only know what I heard

Question: Is the girl ready to give up her ears, her nose, her tongue, her hopes and dreams, her loves and hates, all that makes a girl who she is, forever?
Answer: No. The girl is not ready to become no one. But she is ready to become someone else.

Question: Why Daenerys? Why is she worth all this? As I recall, the Mormonts fought against the Targaryens during Robert's Rebellion.
Answer: Do you believe in anything?

Question: Do you believe in anything?
Answer: I believe in many things.

Question: In something greater than ourselves, I mean. The Gods. Destiny. Do you believe there's a plan for this world?
Answer: No.

Question: Neither did I. I was a cynic, just like you. Then I saw a girl step into a great fire with three stone eggs. When the fire burned out I thought I'd find her blackened bones. Instead I found her. Daenerys. Alive and unhurt. Holding her baby dragons. Have you ever heard baby dragons singing?
Answer: It's hard to be a cynic after that.

Question: The Targaryens are famously insane. What if she conquers the world? Then what? 1,000 years of peace and prosperity?
Answer: First we have to conquer the world.

Question: We? Alright, let's assume your dreams come true. She's ecstatic when you bring her this enemy dwarf. She hacks off my head and restores your position. You command her army, sail to Westeros, defeat all your enemies, then watch as she climbs those steps and sits on the Iron Throne. Hurrah, long live the Queen. Then what?
Answer: Then she rules.

Question: So a woman who has not spent a single day of her adult life in Westeros becomes the ruler of Westeros? That's justice?
Answer: She is the rightful heir.

Question: Why, because her father who burned living men for amusement was the king?
Answer: Shh! It's a slave ship

Question: Why is it anchored?
Answer: They probably came ashore for--

Question: Got a lot of fight in you, huh?
Answer: Salt mines.

Question: What about the dwarf?
Answer: Worthless. Cut his throat.

Question: Wait, wait, wait, wait! You can't just hand a dried cock to a merchant and expect him to pay for it. He has to know it came from a dwarf. And how could he know unless he sees the dwarf?
Answer: It will be a dwarf-sized cock.

Question: Him? He's got to be 60 years old.
Answer: Sure, he's a bit long in the tooth, a bit withered, been in the sun too long. We can all see that. But he is a veteran of 100 battles. They wrote songs about him!

Question: Is that true?
Answer: He won the tournament at Lannisport, unseating Ser Jaime Lannister himself.

Question: Yes? Lancel Lannister.
Answer: Brother Lancel. We abandoned our family names.

Question: I'm here on urgent business for the Queen Mother. Should I send word that I'll be delayed?
Answer: Step carefully, Lord Baelish. You'll find that there's little tolerance for flesh peddlers in the new King's Landing.

Question: Do you think it's wise, your Grace, arresting the heir to Highgarden?
Answer: The Faith arrested the heir to Highgarden.

Question: The King's orders. Is the King to blame for Ser Loras' perversion?
Answer: House Tyrell won't tolerate these insults.

Question: House Tyrell won't tolerate it? I'm the insulted party, Lord Baelish. Ser Loras was promised to me, instead he chose the company of boys.
Answer: One's choice of companion is a curious thing.

Question: If war comes to Westeros will the Knights of the Veil fight for their king?
Answer: Young Lord Robyn heeds my advice. And I have always counseled loyalty to the throne.

Question: Patience? Sansa helped murder my son, Roose Bolton is a traitor.
Answer: Stannis Baratheon is also a traitor, marching with his army on Winterfell. Let Stannis and Roose battle, let the enemies of the throne slaughter each other and when they're done seize Winterfell from whichever thief survives.

Question: You wouldn't risk a single Lannister soldier or a single coin from the Royal Treasury. What do you have to lose, a brothel keeper?
Answer: And if you succeed?

Question: And if you succeed?
Answer: Name me Warden of the North.

Question: What if he says no?
Answer: He won't. You've waited long enough. I want you to be my wife now. What is it?

Question: He won't. You've waited long enough. I want you to be my wife now. What is it?
Answer: Do you want to marry me because our families arranged it, or do you…

Question: Why not?
Answer: You know why not. Someone will see.

Question: How many other girls have you walked through these gardens?
Answer: I like the way your eyes go squinty when you're jealous.

Question: Once we got the princess, then what?
Answer: I like to improvise.

Question: Uncle Jaime? I don't understand, what are you doing here?
Answer: Let's speak in private.

Question: Why don't you let them have some time alone, son?
Answer: Let's not do something stupid.

Question: I am Obara Sand. Daughter of Oberyn Martell. I fight for Dorne. Who do you fight for?
Answer: Drop your weapons!

Question: I was as shocked as anyone when The Faith arrested Ser Loras. I have no love for these fanatics. But what can the queen mother do?
Answer: Has the crown suddenly stopped needing the troops, gold, and wheat my house supplies?

Question: Has the crown suddenly stopped needing the troops, gold, and wheat my house supplies?
Answer: I assure you our alliance with House Tyrell remains--

Question: Do you expect the alliance to continue after you've thrown our future into prison?
Answer: As I said, i didn't imprison anyone. As for your veiled threats--

Question: What veil?
Answer: The Lannister-Tyrell alliance brought peace to a war-torn country. Do you really want to see the Seven Kingdoms slide back into warfare?

Question: The Lannister-Tyrell alliance brought peace to a war-torn country. Do you really want to see the Seven Kingdoms slide back into warfare?
Answer: I didn't trust your father. I didn't particularly like him. But I respected him. He was no fool. He understood that sometimes we must work with our rivals rather than destroy them.

Question: You are aware of the rumors concerning you and Renly?
Answer: I don't pay attention to rumors.

Question: Wasn't Joffrey your king? He was anointed by the 7, not Renly.
Answer: I was wrong to support Renly's claim. I know that. But I was forgiven by Joffrey. I fought for him at the Battle of the Blackwater.

Question: Why does it matter what I wore?
Answer: Do you deny all of the charges against you? Fornication, buggery, blasphemy.

Question: Do you deny all of the charges against you? Fornication, buggery, blasphemy.
Answer: Of course I deny them.

Question: You call me forward?
Answer: Yes. We have some questions for you.

Question: How do you respond to these charges against your brother?
Answer: They are lies.

Question: All of them?
Answer: All of them.

Question: Queen Margaery, in the presence of the gods, do you swear that your brother is innocent of these charges against him, to the best of your knowledge?
Answer: Yes, I swear it.

Question: Do you know this man?
Answer: Yes, very well. He is Ser Loras Tyrell, heir to Highgarden.

Question: How did you come to meet?
Answer: I squired for him. He took a liking to me. He summoned me to his chamber the first day we met.

Question: And what occurred in his chamber?
Answer: We engaged in intimate relations.

Question: You laid with him?
Answer: That night and many others.

Question: Is there anyone else who can support your claim?
Answer: Yes, yes, Queen Margaery. She walked in on us once not long ago. She didn't seem surprised.

Question: This testimony is an insult to a great house. Why should The Faith or anyone else take the word of a squire over the heir to Highgarden?
Answer: He has a birthmark, your grace. Quite high on his thigh, wine-colored, and roughly the shape of Dorne.

Question: What are you doing? Let us pass.
Answer: The Faith is satisfied that there is enough evidence to bring a formal trial for Ser Loras... and Queen Margaery.

Question: What?
Answer: Bearing false witness before the gods is as grave a sin as any. Take her.

Question: What do you want?
Answer: Lord Ramsay sent me to draw your bath, my lady. You want to be clean and fresh for your new husband don't you?

Question: Lord Ramsay sent me to draw your bath, my lady. You want to be clean and fresh for your new husband don't you?
Answer: You're so beautiful. But if you need to keep him happy. Ramsay gets bored easily. You dont want to end up like... Well, like the others.

Question: What others?
Answer: I shouldn't gossip. It's good to see the red again. No point in hiding anymore.

Question: Let's see. There was Kiera. The blacksmith's daughter. She was tall. Like you. Lovely figure. But she talked and talked and talked and… Ramsay got tired of that. Then there was Violet. She had gorgeous blond hair. But she got pregnant and, well, that was boring. Then Tamsay. Such a sweet girl. Of course sweet girls get a bit dull after a while, don't they? Ramsay let me come with him on that hunt.
Answer: Hunt?

Question: Hunt?
Answer: Mm. Have you ever seen a body after the dogs have been at it? Not so pretty. But it's your wedding day, why am I talking about such things?

Question: Mm. Have you ever seen a body after the dogs have been at it? Not so pretty. But it's your wedding day, why am I talking about such things?
Answer: What was your name again?

Question: What was your name again?
Answer: Myranda.

Question: And how long have you loved him, Myranda. Did you imagine that he would be with you forever, is that it? Then I came along and ruined it. I am Sansa Stark of Winterfell. This is my home and you can't frighten me.
Answer: Are you done with your bath, my lady?

Question: Are you done with your bath, my lady?
Answer: Go. I can finish on my own.

Question: Yes?
Answer: I've come to escort you to the Godswood, my lady. If you please, my lady, will you take my arm?

Question: I've come to escort you to the Godswood, my lady. If you please, my lady, will you take my arm?
Answer: No.

Question: Who comes before the Old Gods this night?
Answer: Sansa of the House Stark comes here to be wed. A woman grown, trueborn and noble. She comes to beg the blessings of the gods. Who comes to claim her?

Question: Sansa of the House Stark comes here to be wed. A woman grown, trueborn and noble. She comes to beg the blessings of the gods. Who comes to claim her?
Answer: Ramsay of House Bolton. Heir to the Dreadfort and Winterfell. Who gives her?

Question: Ramsay of House Bolton. Heir to the Dreadfort and Winterfell. Who gives her?
Answer: Theon of House Greyjoy. Who was… who was her father's ward.

Question: Lady Sansa, will you take this man?
Answer: I take this man.

Question: Are you pleased my lady?
Answer: Good. I want you to be happy. My father said you're still a virgin.

Question: Why? Why are you still a virgin? Afraid of dwarves?
Answer: Lord Tyrion was kind, he was gentle, he never touched me.

Question: You're not lying to me?
Answer: No, my lord.

Question: Lying to your husband on his wedding night, that would be a very bad way to start a marriage. We are man and wife now, we should be honest with each other, don't you think?
Answer: Yes sir.

Question: Oh, no no no. You stay here Reek. You watch. Do I need to ask a second time? I hate asking a second time.
Answer: Reek? I told you to watch.

Question: Reek? I told you to watch.
Answer: You've known Sansa since she was a girl. Now watch her become a woman.

Question: What did he do to you?
Answer: Please…

Question: Your name is Theon Greyjoy. Last surviving son of Balon Greyjoy, Lord of the Iron Islands, do you hear me? Theon. Promise me.
Answer: Yes, Reek?

Question: Yes, Reek?
Answer: Egg! Egg! Mothers looking for you! Egg!

Question: When my father told me we were marrying I half expected a fat, bearded beast. Do you know how pleased I was when I saw you? You've made me very happy.
Answer: Our scouts report that Stannis Baratheon rides for Winterfell. He's a respected commander. His troops are loyal and battle tested. He's hired thousands of foreign sell swords to bolster his army. But this storm was a stroke of luck for us northerners. Our people are used to fighting in frost. His army's out there now, suffering in the snow. One day I'll be Lord of Winterfell, and Warden of the North. You'll be my Lady and Wardeness.

Question: But isn't your step mother pregnant?
Answer: What of it?

Question: What of it?
Answer: What happens if she has a boy?

Question: What happens if she has a boy?
Answer: Then I'll have a baby brother.

Question: You didn't know? Yes, he's done very well for himself. Ah. I near forgot why I asked you to join me. Come, my lady.
Answer: Your Northern friend. Reek told me you wanted to leave.

Question: Why? Winterfell is your home and I am your husband.
Answer: Tough old bird. Everyone talks when I start beating them. But this one. Her heart gave out before I got to her face. We do breed them tough in the North. Bring my wife back to her chamber. It's far too cold out here for a lady. You should hold on to your candles. The nights are so long now.

Question: What else?
Answer: The Stormcrows rode off last night.

Question: And?
Answer: This isn't our time, we should head back to Castle Black when the snow clears.

Question: And you, do you trust yourself?
Answer: I trust in the Lord.

Question: Are you sure?
Answer: I have seen myself walk along the battlements of Wintefell. I have seen the flayed men banners lowered to the ground.

Question: Have you lost your mind?
Answer: Do you doubt me still? After all that you've seen?

Question: Do you doubt me still? After all that you've seen?
Answer: There must be another way. Leeches or something.

Question: Where are you going, huh? Aren't we better looking than the fat man?
Answer: The question is, is she pretty down south in the real world, or is she pretty because she's the only girl here?

Question: The question is, is she pretty down south in the real world, or is she pretty because she's the only girl here?
Answer: Even in White Harbor, I'd want a kiss.

Question: Sam the Slayer. Are you gonna slay me with that sword?
Answer: Look at his hands shaking.

Question: You lying sack of shit! Killed a White Walker, eh? You fatass fuck. Come on, get up. He's your hero. He's a hog!
Answer: Leave him alone!

Question: Stubborn little wilding bitch aren't ya?
Answer: Sam! Sam! Sam!

Question: What kind of man would I be if I ran away when I saw someone hurting you?
Answer: Just promise me that whatever happens you'll take care of little Sam.

Question: Am I hurting you?
Answer: Are you sure?

Question: Are you sure?
Answer: Oh. Oh my.

Question: 13. Do I have 14?
Answer: 15? 15 golds honors. Do I have 16?

Question: 15? 15 golds honors. Do I have 16?
Why?
Answer: We're a team. I'm a great fighter, too.

Question: How long before the king of Mereen comes to claim my pillow?
Answer: Don't be ridiculous. My marriage to Hizdahr is political. I think he's smart enough to understand that.

Question: Are you jealous?
Answer: Do you think I'm petty enough to speak ill of a man just because he represents competition?

Question: Do you think I'm petty enough to speak ill of a man just because he represents competition?
Answer: I do.

Question: So what else can I do?
Answer: Marry me instead.

Question: Why not? You're our queen, you can do as you like.
Answer: No. I can't

Question: I know I'm here to serve my queen and not to give advice, but can I make one more suggestion?
Answer: Of course

Question: For me, it's the knees. You?
Answer: Hips.

Question: A man of the people, is that your game? It's an old game. dull and unconvincing. A man of the people who does Cersei's dirty work for her.
Answer: The people always do the dirty work.

Question: What is it you want? Gold? I'll make you the richest septon who ever lived.
Answer: What then?

Question: What then?
Answer: I imagine this is strange for you. Everyone you meet has a hidden motive, and you pride yourself on slitting in and out. But I'm telling you a simple truth

Question: How do they communicate their demands? By raven or horse?
Answer: By the holy text. The seven pointed star. If you don't have one in your library I'll give you my own.

Question: Half the men, women, and children in this foul city break the sacred laws. You live among murderers, thieves, and rapists. And yet you punish Loras for shagging and Margaery for defending her brother?
Answer: Yes. The Gods' laws must be applied to all equally.

Question: Have you ever served the field, Lady Olenna? Have you ever reaped the grain? Has anyone in House Tyrell? A lifetime of wealth and power has left you blind in one eye. You are the few. We are the many. And when the many stop fearing the few…
Answer: Lady Olenna.

Question: And more hands. How's Trystane?
Answer: He'll be alright.

Question: Why is it happening at all?
Answer: Your mother's worried about you. Threats have been made. Dorne is too dangerous for you. I've come to take you home.

Question: This is my home, this has been my home for years. I didn't want to come here but she told me to. I did what she said, I did my duty and now she's forcing me to go back?
Answer: It's for your own good. These are complicated matters.

Question: How's your arm?
Answer: Wonderful. Wouldn't feel right to leave Dorne without a new scar.

Question: You think you're leaving Dorne?
Answer: No great hurry. Dornish women are the most beautiful women in the world.

Question: I'm not the most beautiful woman you've ever seen?
Answer: I've seen quite a few women in all the Seven Kingdoms.

Question: There was a what? In King's Landing you were saying.
Answer: Was I?

Question: Was I?
Answer: There was a woman more beautiful than I am.

Question: Was there? My memory's not what it was earlier.
Answer: How's your arm now?

Question: How's your arm now?
Answer: You seem concerned with it. You must really like me.

Question: And how about your head?
Answer: My head… You don't even wanna know what's going on in…

Question: The only antidote. Who's the most beautiful woman in the world?
Answer: Sorry? Who?

Question: Sorry? Who?
Answer: You.

Question: You've always been rather impressed with yourself, haven't you?
Answer: The past is the past. The future is all that's worth discussing. The future of House Tyrell.

Question: I promise you, Lord Baelish, that our fates are joined. Together we murdered a king. And if my house should fall, I would have nothing to hide. And if i should meet with some accident here at this broken little flesh market, they'll never even find what's left of you. So do you deny a part in all of this?
Answer: Cersei summoned me to King's Landing. I dared not refuse her.

Question: And what did she want?
Answer: A piece of info that she know that I had. Neither silence nor lies were an option. But I have other information of which she is unaware. And as you say, our interests are aligned. I have a gift for you.

Question: What kind of gift?
Answer: The same kind I gave Cersei. A handsome young man.

Question: What are you doing?
Answer: Get him out of my sight.

Question: Who are you?
Answer: I am the gift. It's a pleasure to meet you, Your Grace. My name is Tyrion Lannister.

Question: This is horrible. Unacceptable. Are they feeding you enough at least? I brought you this. Venison. It's quite good. I had it myself for supper only last night. We did everything we could from the moment they took your brother. Tommen even went to the sept himself to confront the high sparrow, but I fear The Faith has left reason behind.
Answer: I know you did this.

Question: Lies come easily to you. Everyone knows that. But innocence, decency, concern? You're not very good at those, I'm afraid. Perhaps that's why your son was so eager to cast you aside for me.
Answer: You're upset. You're not thinking clearly. I'll visit again when you've had a chance to calm down.

Question: Thank you. You saw her?
Answer: Yes.

Question: And?
Answer: Her accommodations seem sufficient. What happens to her now?

Question: Her accommodations seem sufficient. What happens to her now?
Answer: Well she and her brother are both being held under fair suspicion. A trial will be held for each of them to determine if they are guilty of any acts that might constitute a violation of the tenants of the faith.

Question: Who will stand judge?
Answer: Seven septons. As it was in all trials before the Targaryens.

Question: Will you be one of them?
Answer: I will.

Question: What does The Mother's mercy entail?
Answer: It depends on the situation. The acts themselves, the degree of contrition.

Question: Did you know this chapel is one of the oldest structures in King's Landing?
Answer: I think I may have heard at one point.

Question: Who carved this altar do you know?
Answer: I'm afraid i don't.

Question: You will order her to let me go! I am the queen! I am the queen! Have you lost your mind? Let me go! You filthy… I am the queen! Let me go!
Answer: Look at me. Look at my face. It's the last thing you'll see before you die.

Question: You will not speak. How do I know you are who you say you are?
Answer: If only I were otherwise.

Question: If you are Tyrion Lannister why shouldn't I kill you? To pay your family back for what it did to mine
Answer: You want revenge against the Lannisters? I killed my mother Joanna Lannister the day I was born. I killed my father Tywin Lannister with a bow to the heart. I am the greatest Lannister killer of our time.

Question: You want revenge against the Lannisters? I killed my mother Joanna Lannister the day I was born. I killed my father Tywin Lannister with a bow to the heart. I am the greatest Lannister killer of our time.
Answer: So I should welcome you into my service because you murdered members of your own family?

Question: So I should welcome you into my service because you murdered members of your own family?
Answer: Into your service? Your Grace we have only just met. It's too soon to know if you deserve my service.

Question: Into your service? Your Grace we have only just met. It's too soon to know if you deserve my service.
Answer: If you'd rather return to the fighting pits just say the word.

Question: And why are you worth meeting? Why should I spend my time listening to you?
Answer: Because you can not build a better world on your own. You have no one at your side who understands that land you want to rule. The strengths and the weaknesses of the houses that will either support or oppose you.

Question: So you want to advise me. Very well. What would you have me do with him? I swore I would kill him if he ever returned.
Answer: I know.

Question: Why should the people trust a queen who can't keep her promises?
Answer: Whomever Ser Jorah was when he started informing on you, he is no longer that man. I can't remember seeing the same man as devoted to anything as he is to serving you. He claims he would kill for you and die for you, and nothing I have witnessed gives me reason to doubt him. And yet he did betray you.

Question: Did he have an opportunity to confess his betrayals?
Answer: Yes, many opportunities.

Question: And did he?
Answer: No. Not until forced to do so.

Question: So I should kill him?
Answer: A ruler who kills those that are devoted to her is not a ruler that inspires devotion. And you're going to need to inspire devotion, and lots of it, if you're ever going to rule across the Narrow Sea. But you cannot have him by your side when you do.

Question: How will she serve him?
Answer: She will no longer turn left onto Ragman Lane. She will turn right and go to Ragman Harbor.

Question: What will she do there?
Answer: She will see.

Question: See what?
Answer: How can a man tell a girl this. If he knew what she would see, there would be no reason to send her.

Question: Your oysters fresh?
Answer: Best in the city.

Question: You wouldn't lie to an old man would you?
Answer: Very nice. Give me 4. With vinegar.

Question: Please I have 3 children. Without me-- here take it you have to, I have 3 children, what will they do? Please you have to! Please! You don't understand?
Answer: The man is a gambler. He wages that his sailor's ship will make it to its destination. It is a strange wager for the captain. He only wins if he loses his life.

Question: So why would a captain make the wager in the first place?
Answer: A girl tells a man that she has seen.

Question: But perhaps the gambler loses his bet and decides that he doesn't have to pay after all. A destitute woman and her small child, what can they do to such a man if he keeps their money for himself? To whom can they turn for recourse?
Answer: The Many Faced God. You said you didn't know what I would see at the docks.

Question: And then what?
Answer: A gift for the Thin Man.

Question: And if she's not?
Answer: It is all the same to the Many Faced God.

Question: The charges?
Answer: Fornication, treason, incest, the murder of King Robert.

Question: I wish you'd said it sooner. Any word from Jaime?
Answer: I'm afraid not. Your Grace, Grand Maester Pycelle has summoned your Uncle Kevan back from Casterly Rock to serve as Hand of the King. He now presides over the small council.

Question: What about my son, the king? If you can visit me then surely the king--
Answer: Your arrest, and Queen Margaery's arrest, the king has not taken well. He remains in his chambers, his servants often find his food in the hall. Left untouched.

Question: Confess? To the High Sparrow? I won't. I made him. I rose him up from nothing, I will not kneel before some barefooted commoner and beg his forgiveness.
Answer: Goodbye my queen. The work continues.

With fantasies. With beggars in the street. With nothing.

Question: Whether I like her or not is completely unimportant. Margaery is the queen. Queens must command respect. Kings even more so. Not just for their own sake, but for everyone's.
