Question: The first says, “Do you know how to swim?” The second says, “No, but I can shout for help in 19 languages.”
Answer: Ah!

Question: I am soldier all my life. You think I never hear joke?
Answer: You lied to us.

Question: I have your word?
Answer: Oh, good. Good, that's- - that's a fine thing. My uncle will never surrender the castle, ser. Whatever game you're playing.

Question: You should be with them both. I can arrange that, you realize? Comfortable rooms for you at Casterly Rock. A tutor for your boy, knights to train him to fight and to ride. And when he comes of age, he'll have a keep of his own.
Answer: Do you imagine yourself a decent person? Is that it? After you've massacred my family. Kept me in a cell for years. Stolen our lands.

Question: Do you imagine yourself a decent person? Is that it? After you've massacred my family. Kept me in a cell for years. Stolen our lands.
Answer: I'll remind you that our houses are at war. I'm sorry if this conflict has inconvenienced you, but rebelling against the Crown does have consequences.

Question: Did I give you the impression that this was a negotiation? It's not.
Answer: You understand. On some level you understand that you're an evil man.

Question: Well, that is convenient for you. You're a fine-looking fellow, aren't you?
Answer: Your square jaw, your golden armor. Tell me, I want to know. I truly do. How do you live with yourself? All of us have to believe that we're decent, don't we? You have to sleep at night. How do you tell yourself that you're decent after everything that you've done?

Question: Your square jaw, your golden armor. Tell me, I want to know. I truly do. How do you live with yourself? All of us have to believe that we're decent, don't we? You have to sleep at night. How do you tell yourself that you're decent after everything that you've done?
Answer: I was your sister's prisoner once. She hit me on the head with a rock if I remember correctly.

Question: Do you think I care whom you admire and whom you don't?
Answer: No, I don't, but I'm telling you anyway because you're my prisoner. You don't have a choice. The love she had for her children, I was a little awed by it. Reminded me of my sister.

Question: Who goes there?
Answer: Edmure Tully, son of Hoster Tully, and the rightful Lord of Riverrun. I demand entry.

Question: He's been their captive ever since they murdered his king at the Red Wedding. Why do you think the people who murdered his king at the Red Wedding would decide to let him come home? Because it's a trap, you idiot. Don't let him in.
Answer: He's my lord, my lord. I've sworn to serve the Lord of Riverrun and obey his commands.

Question: All right, what should the army do?
Answer: We'll not go to the beach. If we go to the beach, the Masters will take the pyramid. The pyramid is the only place in the city we can defend. We stay here.

Question: And then?
Answer: We wait for them to come to us. Then we fight them.

Question: What the fuck you doing here?
Answer: Chasing them. You?

Question: Chasing them. You?
Answer: Hanging them.

Question: Any particular reason?
Answer: They're our men. Or they were. They attacked a nearby sept and murdered the villagers. Why do you want them?

Question: They're our men. Or they were. They attacked a nearby sept and murdered the villagers. Why do you want them?
Answer: Same reason. I was helping build it. They killed a friend of mine.

Question: You've got friends?
Answer: Not anymore. They're mine.

Question: hanging? All over in an instant. Where's the punishment in that?
Answer: They die.

Question: Got anything to eat?
Answer: Enjoying yourself?

Question: Enjoying yourself?
Answer: I prefer chicken.

Question: And you're going to go stop them?
Answer: We need good men to help us.

Question: True enough. But the Lord of Light gave you the power to defeat me. Why?
Answer: I beat you because I'm better than you, Beric. I was better than you before you started yammering on about the Lord and I'm better than you now.

Question: Aye, you're probably right. You're a fighter. You were born a fighter. You walked away from the fight. How did that go? Good and bad, young and old, the things we're fighting will destroy them all alike. You can still help a lot more than you've harmed Clegane, it's not too late for you.
Answer: Lady Crane?

Question: Lady Crane?
Answer: If you'd have done your job, she would have died painlessly.

Question: It will all be over soon. On your knees or on your feet?
Answer: Haven't we been through this already? That won't help you.

Question: Haven't we been through this already? That won't help you.
Answer: You told her to kill me.

Question: The city is on the rise?
Answer: Meereen is strong. Commerce has returned to the markets. The people are behind you.

Question: Good. Shall we begin?
Answer: Do we have a plan?

Question: Do we have a plan?
Answer: I will crucify the Masters. I will set their fleets afire, kill every last one of their soldiers, and return their cities to the dirt. That is my plan.

Question: You don't approve?
Answer: You once told me you knew what your father was. Did you know his plans for King's Landing when the Lannister armies were at his gates?

Question: You once told me you knew what your father was. Did you know his plans for King's Landing when the Lannister armies were at his gates?
Answer: Probably not. Well, he told my brother and Jaime told me. He had caches of wildfire hidden under the Red Keep, the Guildhalls, the Sept of Baelor, all the major thoroughfares. He would have burned every one of his citizens. The loyal ones and the trators. Every man, woman, and child. That's why Jaime killed him.

Question: It always seems a bit abstract, doesn't it, other people dying?
Answer: Him. He should die.

Question: Thank you for returning Lady Bolton safely. Now, dismount and kneel before me, surrender your army and proclaim me the true Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North. I will pardon you for deserting the Night's Watch. I will pardon these treasonous lords for betraying my house. Come, bastard, you don't have the men, you don't have the horses, and you don't have Winterfell. Why lead those pour souls into slaughter? There's no need for a battle. Get off your hose and kneel. I'm a man of mercy.
Answer: You're right. There's no need for a battle. Thousands of men don't need to die. Only one of us. Let's end this the old way. You against me.

Question: I keep hearing stories about you, bastard. The way people in the North talk about you, you're the greatest swordsman who ever walked. Maybe you are that good. Maybe not. I don't know if I'd beat you. But I know that my army will beat yours. I have 6,000 men. You have, what, half that? Not even?
Answer: Aye, you have the numbers. Will your men want to fight for you when they hear you wouldn't fight for them?

Question: Aye, you have the numbers. Will your men want to fight for you when they hear you wouldn't fight for them?
Answer: He's good. Very good. Tell me, will you let your little brother die because you're too proud to surrender?

Question: He's good. Very good. Tell me, will you let your little brother die because you're too proud to surrender?
Answer: How do we know you have him?

Question: How do we know you have him?
Answer: Now, if you want to save —

Question: She's a fine woman, your sister. I look forward to having her back in my bed. And you're all fine-looking men. My dogs are desperate to meet you. I haven't fed them for seven days. They're ravenous. I wonder which parts they'll try first. Your eyes? Your balls? We'll find out soon enough. In the morning, then, bastard.
Answer: If he was smart, he'd stay inside the walls of Winterfell and wait us out.

Question: Did you really think that cunt would fight you man to man?
Answer: No. But I wanted to make him angry. I want him coming at us full tilt.

Question: You've known him for the space of a single conversation, you and your trusted advisors, and you sit around and make your plans on how to defeat a man you don't know. I lived with him. I know the way his mind works. I know how he likes to hurt people. Did it ever once occur to you that I might have some insight?
Answer: You're right.

Question: Aye, and what have I been doing all my life? Playing with broomsticks? I fought beyond the Wall against worse than Ramsay Bolton. I've defended the Wall from worse than Ramsay Bolton.
Answer: You don't know him.

Question: All right, tell me. What should we do? How do we get Rickon back?
Answer: We'll never get him back. Rickon is Ned Starks trueborn son, which makes him a greater threat to Ramsay than you, a bastard, or me, a girl. As long as he lives, Ramsay's claim to Winterfell will be contested, which means he won't live long.

Question: Of course he does. What should I do differently?
Answer: I don't know! I don't know anything about battles! Just don't do what he wants you to do.

Question: You think that's obvious?
Answer: Well, it is a bit obvious.

Question: If you had asked for my advice earlier, I would have told you not to attack Winterfell until we have a larger force, or is that obvious, too?
Answer: When will we have a larger force?! We've pleaded with every house that'll have us! The Blackfish can't help us! We're lucky to have this many men!

Question: When will we have a larger force?! We've pleaded with every house that'll have us! The Blackfish can't help us! We're lucky to have this many men!
Answer: It's not enough!

Question: If Ramsay wins, I'm not going back there alive. Do you understand me?
Answer: SNOW I won't ever let him touch you again. I'll protect you, I promise.

Question: You think there's hope?
Answer: I've never seen these Bolton fuckers fight. And they've never seen the free folk fight, so, yes, there's hope. You want to avenge your king, don't you?

Question: I've never seen these Bolton fuckers fight. And they've never seen the free folk fight, so, yes, there's hope. You want to avenge your king, don't you?
Answer: It wasn't the Boltons defeated Stannis. It was Stannis himself. I loved the man. He lifted me up and made me something. But he had demons in his skull whispering foul things.

Question: You saw these demons?
Answer: What?

Question: What?
Answer: No, it's a manner of speaking. Not actual demons.

Question: I need a good drink to help me sleep the night before a fight. You want some? I have a jug of sour goat's milk stronger than any of that grape water you southern twats like sucking on.
Answer: No, thanks. It does sound delicious, but I better keep a clear head. I can never sleep the night before a battle.

Question: So what do you do all night?
Answer: I walk. Think and walk. Think and walk until I'm far enough away from camp that no one can hear me shitting my guts out.

Question: Any advice?
Answer: Don't lose.

Question: How do you know what he commands?
Answer: I interpret his signs as well as I can. If the Lord didn't want me to bring you back, how did I bring you back? I have no power. Only what he gives me and he gave me you.

Question: I interpret his signs as well as I can. If the Lord didn't want me to bring you back, how did I bring you back? I have no power. Only what he gives me and he gave me you.
Answer: Why?

Question: Why?
Answer: I don't know. Maybe you're only needed for this small part of his plan and nothing else. Maybe he brought you here to die again.

Question: What kind of god would do something like that?
Answer: The one we've got.

Question: Last time we saw each other was at Winterfell, yes? You were making jokes about my height, I seem to recall. Everyone who makes a joke about a dwarf's height thinks he's the only person ever to make a joke about a dwarf's height. “The height of nobility,” “a man of your stature,” “someone to look up to.” You're all making the same five or six jokes.
Answer: It was a long time ago.

Question: It was. And how have things been going for you since then? Not so well, I gather. Can't imagine you would have murdered the Stark boys if things had been going well.
Answer: I didn't murder the Stark boys. But I did things that were just as bad or worse.

Question: Doesn't seem like it. He's still alive. It was complicated for you, I'm sure, growing up at Winterfell. Never quite knowing who you were. But then, we all live complicated lives, don't we?
Answer: You've brought us 100 ships from the Iron Fleet with men to sail them. In return, I expect you want me to support your claim to the throne of the Iron Islands?

Question: You've brought us 100 ships from the Iron Fleet with men to sail them. In return, I expect you want me to support your claim to the throne of the Iron Islands?
Answer: Not my claim. Hers.

Question: And what's wrong with you?
Answer: I'm not fit to rule.

Question: Has the Iron Islands ever had a queen before?
Answer: No more than Westeros.

Question: Will their ships be enough?
Answer: With the former Masters' fleet, possibly. Barely. There are more than 100 ships in the Iron Fleet.

Question: So why shouldn't I wait for him?
Answer: The Iron Fleet isn't all he's bringing. He also wants to give you --

Question: And I imagine your offer is free of any marriage demands?
Answer: I never demand, but I'm up for anything, really.

Question: And you don't want the Seven Kingdoms?
Answer: Your ancestors defeated ours and took the Iron Islands. We ask you to give them back.

Question: And that's all?
Answer: We'd like you to help us murder an uncle or two who don't think a woman's fit to rule.

Question: What if everyone starts demanding their independence?
Answer: She's not demanding, she's asking. The others are free to ask as well. Our father were evil men, all of us here. They left the world worse than they found it. We're not going to do that. We're going to leave the world better than we found it.

Question: Do you like games, little man? Let's play a game. Run to your brother. The sooner you make it to him, the sooner you get to see him. That's it. That's the game. Easy. Ready? Go.
Answer: No, you have to run, remember? Those are the rules.

Question: No, you have to run, remember? Those are the rules.
Answer: Don't.

Question: Who owns the North?
Answer: We do!

Question: You suggested one on one combat, didn't you?
Answer: I've reconsidered. I think that sounds like a wonderful idea.

Question: Where is he?
Answer: Ah. Sansa. Hello, Sansa. Is this where I'll be staying now? No. Our time together is about to come to an end. That's all right. You can't kill me. I'm part of you now.

Question: Ah. Sansa. Hello, Sansa. Is this where I'll be staying now? No. Our time together is about to come to an end. That's all right. You can't kill me. I'm part of you now.
Answer: Your words will disappear. Your house will disappear. Your name will disappear. All memory of you will disappear.

Question: You got my money?
Answer: Later. Go away.

Question: Ser Loras Tyrell. Are you prepared to stand trial and profess your guilt or innocence before the Seven?
Answer: There'll be no need for a trial. I confess before the Seven and freely admit to my crimes.

Question: To which crimes will you be confessing?
Answer: All of them. I lay with other men including the traitor Renly Baratheon.

Question: You understand fully what this means?
Answer: I do. I will abandon the Tyrell name and all that goes with it. I will renounce my lordship and my claims on Highgarden. I will never marry and I will never father children.

Question: Will you fight to defend your faith against heretics and apostates?
Answer: I will.

Question: And where is the queen mother?
Answer: Her litter never left the Red Keep.

Question: Where's the king?
Answer: Elsewhere, I'm afraid.

Question: What's the meaning of this? I was told that-- I have more important things to do with my time than waste them in the presence--
Answer: Please, Grand Maester. I bear you no ill will. Please forgive me if you can.

Question: What are you doing?
Answer: There's something wrong.

Question: Cersei is not here. Tommen is not here. Why do you think they are not here?
Answer: If the accused is not here, she will be tried regardless. We cannot escape the justice of the gods--

Question: I said my face would be the last thing you saw before you died. Do you remember?
Answer: Good. I'm glad to see your face. I'm ready to meet the gods.

Question: What? Now? Today? You're not going to die today. You're not going to die for quite a while. Ser Gregor.
Answer: This is Ser Gregor Clegane. He's quiet, too.

Question: You don't even have to do anything, do you?
Answer: You just sit there, a rich slab of beef, and all the birds come pecking.

Question: Not blonde enough?
Answer: Ladies, have you met Ser Bronn of the Blackwater, hero of the Battle of Blackwater Bay.

Question: So the famous Blackfish killed by footsoldiers, eh? Legendary warrior, everyone said.
Answer: Have you done much fighting yourself, Lord Frey?

Question: Have you done much fighting yourself, Lord Frey?
Answer: I'm a bit old for all that.

Question: The purpose of fighting is defeating your enemies, isn't it?
Answer: I've defeated mine. Riverrun belonged to House Tully for a thousand years. Now it's mine. What do you call that? Victory.

Question: I've defeated mine. Riverrun belonged to House Tully for a thousand years. Now it's mine. What do you call that? Victory.
Answer: Yes, you're a great conqueror.

Question: Go on, mock me, boy. You think I mind? The Tullys mocked me for years. The Starks mocked me. Where are they now? You talk about war as if you're an expert but the one battle I remember you fighting, you were captured by Robb Stark, the Young Wolf. But it doesn't matter. Here we are now, two kingslayers. We know what it's like to have them grovel to our faces and snigger behind our backs. We don't mind, do we? Fear is a marvelous thing.
Answer: They don't fear the Freys, though. They fear the Lannisters. We gave you the Riverlands to hold the Riverlands. If we have to ride north and take them back for you every time you lose them, why do we need you?

Question: They don't fear the Freys, though. They fear the Lannisters. We gave you the Riverlands to hold the Riverlands. If we have to ride north and take them back for you every time you lose them, why do we need you?
Answer: Show me.

Question: What are your thoughts concerning the king's funeral? As the Sept of Baelor is no longer an option, perhaps a ceremony in the throne room?
Answer: He should be with his grandfather, his brother, his sister. Burn him and bury his ashes where the sept once stood.

Question: What is that?
Answer: Tell him. Tell him who it belonged to.

Question: Why?
Answer: The army was trapped. The horses were dying. It was the only way.

Question: The only way for what? They all died anyway! You told everyone Stannis was the one. You had him believing it, all of them fooled. And you lied.
Answer: I didn't lie. I was wrong.

Question: Aye, you were wrong. How many died because you were wrong?
Answer: I ask your leave to execute this woman for murder. She admits to the crime.

Question: Do you have anything to say for yourself?
Answer: I've been ready to die for many years. If the Lord was done with me, so be it, but he's not. You've seen the Night King, Jon Snow. You know the great war is still to come. You know the army of the dead will be upon us soon. And you know I can help you win that war.

Question: Mother and Father's room? You should take it.
Answer: I'm not a Stark.

Question: And you trust him?
Answer: Only a fool would trust Littlefinger. I should have told you about him, about the Knights of the Vale. I'm sorry.

Question: Well, Father always promised, didn't he?
Answer: The last time a Tyrell came to Dorne, he was assassinated. 100 red scorpions, was it?

Question: The last time a Tyrell came to Dorne, he was assassinated. 100 red scorpions, was it?
Answer: You have nothing to fear from us, Lady Olenna.

Question: You murder your own prince, but you expect me to trust you?
Answer: We invited you to Dorne because we needed your help. You came to Dorne because you needed our help?

Question: We invited you to Dorne because we needed your help. You came to Dorne because you needed our help?
Answer: What is your name again? Barbaro?

Question: What is your name again? Barbaro?
Answer: Obara.

Question: Anything from you?
Answer: No? Good. Let the grown women speak.

Question: No? Good. Let the grown women speak.
Answer: The Lannisters have declared war on House Tyrell. They have declared war on Dorne. We must be allies now if we wish to survive.

Question: And what is my heart's desire?
Answer: Vengeance. Justice.

Question: New strategy? You want the Second Sons to attack from the west coast? If we take Casterly Rock, the Lannisters will have nowhere to run when you hit King's Landing.
Answer: You're not going to Westeros. You're staying here with the Second Sons. There's finally peace in Meereen. You will keep the peace while the people choose their own leaders.

Question: Who are you marrying this time?
Answer: I don't know. Maybe no one.

Question: But you need to lure all the noble houses to the table? Are you a queen or fish bait?
Answer: I can't bring a lover to Westeros.

Question: So that's what you want? To be my mistress?
Answer: I'm not proud. I don't care what perfumed aristocrat sits beside you in the throne room. I don't want a crown. I want you.

Question: I'm not angry. I'm full of self-pity. Who comes after you? Who can ever follow Daenerys Stormborn, the Mother of Dragons?
Answer: A great number of women, I imagine. Specific orders will be left for you regarding the welfare of Meereen and the Bay of Dragons.

Question: Bay of Dragons?
Answer: We can't call it Slaver's Bay anymore, can we?

Question: We can't call it Slaver's Bay anymore, can we?
Answer: You'll get that throne you want so badly, I'm sure of it. I hope it brings you happiness.

Question: How did he take it?
Answer: No tears.

Question: All right, how about the fact that this is actually happening? You have your armies, you have your ships, you have your dragons. Everything you've ever wanted since you were old enough to want anything. It's all yours for the taking. Are you afraid?
Answer: Good. You're in the great game now. And the great game's terrifying. The only people who aren't afraid of failure are madmen like your father.

Question: Do you know what frightens me? I said farewell to a man who loves me. A man I thought I cared for. And I felt nothing. Just impatient to get on with it.
Answer: He wasn't the first to love you and he won't be the last.

Question: You're not one of mine, are you?
Answer: No, my lord.

Question: Where are my damn moron sons? Black Walder and Lothar promised to be here by midday.
Answer: They're here, my lord.

Question: Well, what are they doing, trimming their cunt hairs? Tell them to come here now.
Answer: But they're already here, my lord.

Question: What do you want?
Answer: I thought you knew what I wanted.

Question: No, you weren't. Every time I'm faced with a decision, I close my eyes and see the same picture. Whenever I consider an action, I ask myself will this action help to make this picture a reality? Pull it out of my mind and into the world? And I only act if the answer is yes. A picture of me on the Iron Throne… and you by my side.
Answer: It's a pretty picture.

Question: The past is gone for good. You can sit here mourning its departure or you can prepare for the future. You, my love, are the future of House Stark. Who should the North rally behind? A trueborn daughter of Ned and Catelyn Stark born here at Winterfell or a motherless bastard born in the south?
Answer: This is where I leave you.

Question: You're not coming with us?
Answer: The Wall is not just ice and stone. Ancient spells were carved into its foundations. Strong magic to protect men from what lies beyond. And while it stands, the dead cannot pass. I cannot pass.

Question: Where will you go?
Answer: The great war is coming and I still fight for the living. I'll do what I can… as long as I can.

Question: Are you sure you're ready for this?
Answer: I'm the Three-Eyed Raven now. I have to be ready for this.

Question: Ned?
Answer: Lyanna.

Question: Is that you? Is that really you?
Answer: You're not a dream.

Question: Is there a maester?
Answer: Please. Listen to me, Ned.

Question: You're wonder why I brought you all here. After all, we just had a feast. Since when does old Walder give us two feasts in a single fortnight?
Answer: Well, it's no good being lord of the Riverlands if you can't celebrate with your family. That's what I say!

Question: You wildlings?
Answer: I'm Meera Reed, daughter of Howland Reed. This is Brandon Stark, son of Ned Stark.

Question: How do I know that's true?
Answer: You were at the Fist of the First Men. You were at Hardhome. You've seen the Army of the Dead. You've seen the Night King. He's coming for us. For all of us.

Question: You expect me to put a spear in my granddaughter's hand?
Answer: I don't plan on knitting by the fire while men fight for me. I might be small, Lord Glover, and I might be a girl, but I am every bit as much a Northerner as you.

Question: You want us to man the castles for you?
Answer: Last time we saw the Night King was at Hardhome. The closest castle to Hardhome is Eastwatch-by-the-Sea.

Question: So there's no punishment for treason and no reward for loyalty?
Answer: The punishment for treason is death. Smalljon Umber died on the field of battle. Harald Karstark died on the field of battle.

Question: Yesterday's wars don't matter anymore. The North needs to band together, all the living north. Will you stand beside me, Ned and Alys, now and always?
Answer: Now and always!

Question: Will you start wearing a crown?
Answer: When you question my decisions in front of the other lords and ladies, you undermine me.

Question: So I can't question your decisions anymore?
Answer: Of course you can, but--

Question: Joffrey never let anyone question his authority. You think he was a good king?
Answer: Do you think I'm Joffrey?

Question: Do you think I'm Joffrey?
Answer: You're as far from Joffrey as anyone I've ever met.

Question: At what?
Answer: At ruling.

Question: Why are you laughing?
Answer: What did father used to say? Everything before the word "but" is horse shit.

Question: What did father used to say? Everything before the word "but" is horse shit.
Answer: He never said that to me.

Question: And how should I be smarter? By listening to you?
Answer: Would that be so terrible?

Question: Would that be so terrible?
Answer: A raven from King's Landing, Your Grace.

Question: What does she want?
Answer: Come to King's Landing. Bend the knee or suffer the fate of all traitors.

Question: What is this?
Answer: Its what we've been waiting for our whole lives. It's what Father trained us for, whether he knew it or not.

Question: You've been quiet since you came home. Are you angry with me?
Answer: No, not angry.

Question: Are you afraid of me?
Answer: Should I be?

Question: Should I be?
Answer: Daenerys Targaryen has chosen Tyrion to be her Hand. Right now, they're sailing across the Narrow Sea, hoping to take back her father's throne. Our little brother, the one you love so much, the one you set free, the one who murdered our father and our first-born son, now he stands beside our enemies and gives them counsel. He's out there somewhere at the head of an armada. Where will they land?

Question: Daenerys Targaryen has chosen Tyrion to be her Hand. Right now, they're sailing across the Narrow Sea, hoping to take back her father's throne. Our little brother, the one you love so much, the one you set free, the one who murdered our father and our first-born son, now he stands beside our enemies and gives them counsel. He's out there somewhere at the head of an armada. Where will they land?
Answer: Dragonstone.

Question: Enemies to the north. Ned Stark's bastard has been named King in the North and that murdering whore Sansa stands beside him. Enemies everywhere. We're surrounded by traitors. You're in command of the Lannister army now. How do we proceed?
Answer: Winter is here. We can't win a war if we can't feed our men and our horses. The Tyrells have the grain, the Tyrells have the livestock.

Question: Will the Tyrell bannermen stand alongside a Dothraki horde and Unsullied slave soldiers?
Answer: If they think Daenerys will win. No one wants to fight on the losing side. Right now, we look like the losing side.

Question: A dynasty for whom? Our children are dead. We're the last of us.
Answer: A dynasty for us, then.

Question: He betrayed me. He betrayed us both. Should we spend our days mourning the dead--mother, father, and all our children?
Answer: Cersei--

Question: Even Lannisters can't survive without allies. Where are our allies now? You saw what happened to Walder Frey and his family.
Answer: I heard. How could we ever trust a man like that?

Question: I heard. How could we ever trust a man like that?
Answer: We couldn't. He was a useless, old coward, but the Freys supported us. Now they're all dead. Whoever killed them is no friend of ours. We need allies. Stronger, better allies. We can't win this war alone.

Question: You think I listened to Father for 40 years and learned nothing?
Answer: The Greyjoys? You invited the Greyjoys to King's Landing?

Question: The Greyjoys? You invited the Greyjoys to King's Landing?
Answer: Not all of them.

Question: How are they better allies? How are they different from the Freys? They both broke their promises and murdered their former friends as soon as it suited them.
Answer: So does everyone when it suits them. Unlike the Freys, they have ships. And they're good at killing.

Question: Oh, what did he come here for, then?
Answer: A queen.

Question: You're not a rightful monarch, though, are you?
Answer: The Greyjoys rebelled agains the throne for the right to be monarchs, but as I recall, you were soundly defeated. Come to mention it, weren't you the one who started that rebellion by sailing to Casterly Rock and burning the Lannister fleet? You certainly caught us there. Very smart move on your part. Of course, we all made it to the Iron Islands anyway. I was there.

Question: The Greyjoys rebelled agains the throne for the right to be monarchs, but as I recall, you were soundly defeated. Come to mention it, weren't you the one who started that rebellion by sailing to Casterly Rock and burning the Lannister fleet? You certainly caught us there. Very smart move on your part. Of course, we all made it to the Iron Islands anyway. I was there.
Answer: I remember very well. I saw you. I heard so much talk. The best in the world. No one can stop him. I didn't believe it, to be honesty. But I must say, when you rushed through the breach and started cutting people down...it was glorious. Like a dance.

Question: What do you want in return?
Answer: Ever since I was a little boy, I wanted to grow up and mary the most beautiful woman in the world. So here I am, with a thousand ships and two good hands.

Question: Why?
Answer: You're not trustworthy. You've broken promises to allies before and murdered them at the nearest opportunity. You murdered your own brother.

Question: What's the weight?
That area is reserved for maesters. Are you a maester?
Answer: No.

Question: Not a very strong proposition, is it?
Answer: Archmaester, with respect, I've seen them--the Army of the Dead. The white walkers. W was sent here to learn how to defeat them, but everyone in the Citadel, those who will even talk to me, they all doubt the walkers ever existed in the first place.

Question: Sources in the restricted area?
Answer: The very same. And the simplest explanation for your grating obsession with the white walkers is that you're telling the truth and that you saw what you say you saw.

Question: I do. You'll finish weighing that heart?
Answer: That makes you the only person south of the Twins who does.

Question: We're not lie the people south of the Twins. And we're not like the people north of the Twins. In the Citadel, we lead different lives for different reasons. We are this worldo s memory, Samwell Tarly. Without us, men would be little better than dogs. Don't remember any meal but the last, can't see forward to any but the next. And every time you leave the house and shut the door, they howl like you're gone forever. When Robert's Rebellion was raging, people that the end was near. The end of the Targaryen dynasty. "How will we survive?" When Aegon Targaryen turned his eye westward and flew his dragons to Blackwater Rush--"The end is near! How will we survive?" And thousands of year before that, during the Long Night, we can forgive them for thinking it truly was the end. But it wasn't. None of it was. The Wall has stood through it all. And every winter that ever came has ended.
Answer: Be a good lad. Clean this up.

Question: What do you want, Lord Baelish?
Answer: I want you to be happy. I want you to be safe.

Question: What about happy? Why aren't you happy? What do you want that you do not have?
Answer: At the moment, peace and quiet.

Question: Why is he still here?
Answer: We need his men. Without the Vale, Ramsay Bolton would still hold this castle. Littlefinger saved us.

Question: Are you hungry? We've got some rabbit.
Answer: I don't want to steal your food.

Question: You heading south?
Answer: King's Landing.

Question: Not so bad, is it?
Answer: Depends on your taste, I guess. If you like your streets covered in shit and pig's blood, it's the town for you.

Question: What are you doing in the Riverlands?
Answer: There's been some trouble with the Freys up at The Twins, so we're part of the army that's been sent to keep the peace.

Question: Boy or girl?
Answer: Oh, who knows? You think soldiers get ravens with news from home?

Question: Oh, who knows? You think soldiers get ravens with news from home?
Answer: I hope it's a girl.

Question: Why?
Answer: Girls take care of their papas when their papas grow old. Boys just go off to fight in someone else's wars.

Question: Are you old enough to drink?
Answer: It's blackberry wine. I made it myself.

Question: So, why is a nice girl on her own heading to King's Landing?
Answer: I'm going to kill the queen.

Question: You've got real powerful magic to figure that out. Did the Lord of Light whisper that in your ear? "It's snowing, Thoros. It's windy. It's gonna be a cold night."
Answer: You're a grouchy old bear, aren't you, Clegane? You want some rum?

Question: You're a grouchy old bear, aren't you, Clegane? You want some rum?
Answer: Don't like that shit. It's too sweet.

Question: Why are you always in such a foul mood?
Answer: Experience.

Question: How do you think it ended for them?
Answer: With death.

Question: So why does the Lord of Light keep bringing you back? I've met better men than you, and they've been hanged from crossbeams, or beheaded, or just shat themselves to death in a field somewhere. None of them came back. So, why you?
Answer: You think I don't ask myself that? Every hour of every day? Why am I here? What am I supposed to do? What does the Lord see in me?

Question: You think I don't ask myself that? Every hour of every day? Why am I here? What am I supposed to do? What does the Lord see in me?
Answer: And?

Question: And?
Answer: I don't know. I don't understand our Lord.

Question: If he's so all-powerful, why doesn't he just tell you what the fuck he wants?
Answer: Clegane.

Question: What do you want?
Answer: Look into the flames.

Question: You saw me bring him back from the dead after you cut him down. Don't you want to know what gave me the power?
Answer: I keep asking and no one wants to tell me.

Question: What do you see?
Answer: Logs burning.

Question: Keep looking. What do you see?
Answer: Ice. A wall of ice. The Wall.

Question: What else?
Answer: It's where the Wall meets the sea. There's a castle there.

Question: Do you believe me now, Clegane? Do you believe we're here for a reason?
Answer: What the hell are you doing, Clegane?

Question: What the hell are you doing, Clegane?
Answer: Burying the dead.

Question: What is it?
Answer: It's a map of Dragonstone. The Targaryens built their first stronghold there when they invaded Westeros.

Question: That's dragonglass?
Answer: A mountain of it. Beneath the ground. Stannis told me, but I didn't think... This is important. Jon needs to know.

Question: Has she come yet?
Answer: Who?

Question: Who?
Answer: The Dragon Queen. Daenerys Stormborn.

Question: Shall we begin?
Answer: On a night like this, you came into the world.

Question: They cry out for their true queen? They drink secret toasts to my health?
Answer: People used to tell my brother that sort of thing, and he was stupid enough to believe them.

Question: You served my father, didn't you, Lord Varys?
Answer: I did.

Question: And then you served the man who overthrew him?
Answer: I had a choice, Your Grace--serve Robert Baratheon or face the headman's axe.

Question: Before I came to power, you favored my brother. All your spies, your little birds, did they tell you Viserys was cruel, stupid, and weak? Would those qualities have made for a good king in your learned opinion?
Answer: Until your marriage to Khal Drogo, Your Grace, I knew nothing about you, save your existence and that you were said to be beautiful.

Question: Who gave the order to kill me?
Answer: King Robert.

Question: Who hired the assassins?
Answer: Who sent word to Essos to murder Daenerys Targaryen?

Question: Who sent word to Essos to murder Daenerys Targaryen?
Answer: Your Grace, I did what had to be done to--

Question: Proven himself loyal? Quite the opposite. If he dislikes one monarch, he conspires to crown the next one. What king of a servant is that?
Answer: The kind the realm needs. Incompetence should not be rewarded with blind loyalty. As long as I have my eyes, I'll use them. I wasn't born into a great house. I came from nothing. I was sold as a slave and carved up as an offering. When I was a child, I lived in alleys, gutters, abandoned houses. You wish to know where my true loyalties lie? Not with any king or queen, but with the people. The people who suffer under despots and prosper under just rule. The people whose hearts you aim to win. If you demand blind allegiance, I respect your wishes. Grey Worm can behead me or your dragons can devour me. But if you let me live, I will serve you well. I will dedicate myself to seeing you on the Iron Throne because I choose you. Because I know the people have no better chance than you.

Question: The kind the realm needs. Incompetence should not be rewarded with blind loyalty. As long as I have my eyes, I'll use them. I wasn't born into a great house. I came from nothing. I was sold as a slave and carved up as an offering. When I was a child, I lived in alleys, gutters, abandoned houses. You wish to know where my true loyalties lie? Not with any king or queen, but with the people. The people who suffer under despots and prosper under just rule. The people whose hearts you aim to win. If you demand blind allegiance, I respect your wishes. Grey Worm can behead me or your dragons can devour me. But if you let me live, I will serve you well. I will dedicate myself to seeing you on the Iron Throne because I choose you. Because I know the people have no better chance than you.
Answer: Swear this to me, Varys. If you ever think I'm failing the people, you won't conspire behind my back. You'll look me in the eye as you have done today, and you'll tell me how I'm failing them.

Question: The Red Priests helped bring peace to Meereen. You are very welcome here. What is your name?
Answer: I am called Melisandre.

Question: She once served another who wanted the Iron Throne. It didn't end well for Stannis Baratheon, did it?
Answer: No, it didn't.

Question: The Lord of Light doesn't have many followers in Westeros, does he?
Answer: Not yet. But even those who don't worship the Lord can serve his cause.

Question: What does your Lord expect from me?
Answer: The Long Night is coming. Only the prince who was promised can bring the dawn.

Question: Doesn't really roll off the tongue, does it?
Answer: No, but I like it better.

Question: And you believe this prophecy refers to me?
Answer: Prophecies are dangerous things. I believe you have a role to play, as does another. The King in the North, Jon Snow.

Question: Jon Snow? Ned Stark's bastard?
Answer: You know him?

Question: You know him?
Answer: I traveled with him to the Wall when he joined the Night's Watch.

Question: And why do you think the Lord of Light singled out this Jon Snow aside from the visions you've seen in the flames, that is?
Answer: As Lord Commander of the Night's Watch he allowed the Wildlings south of the Wall to protect them from great danger. As King in the North he has united those Wildlings with the northern houses so together they may face their common enemy.

Question: Do you think it's really Tyrion? It could be someone trying to lure you into a trap.
Answer: Read the last bit.

Question: All dwarfs are bastards in their father's eyes." What does that mean?
Answer: It's something he said to me the first night we met. You know him better than any of us. What do you think?

Question: It's something he said to me the first night we met. You know him better than any of us. What do you think?
Answer: Tyrion is not like the other Lannisters. He was always kind to me, but it's too great a risk. "The Seven Kingdoms will bleed as long as Cersei sits on the Iron Throne. Join us. Together we can end her tyranny."

Question: What?
Answer: Fire kills Whites, you told me. What breathes fire?

Question: Fire kills Whites, you told me. What breathes fire?
Answer: You're not suggesting Jon meet with her?

Question: You're not suggesting Jon meet with her?
Answer: No, too dangerous.

Question: But?
Answer: But if the Army of the Dead makes it passed the Wall, do we have enough men to fight them?

Question: But if the Army of the Dead makes it passed the Wall, do we have enough men to fight them?
Answer: If the Mad King's daughter takes the Iron Throne, she will destroy the Realm as we know it. Some of you are bannermen of House Tyrell. But House Tyrell is in open rebellion against the Crown. With their help the Mad King's daughter has ferried an army of savages to our shores. Mindless Unsullied soldiers who will destroy your castles and your holdfasts. Dothraki heathens who will burn your villages to the ground, rape and enslave your women, and butcher your children without a second thought. This is how Olenna Tyrell rewards centuries of service and loyalty.

Question: She has three full-grown dragons, Your Grace. The same as Aegon when he conquered the Seven Kingdoms. How do you propose to stop them?
Answer: We are currently at work on a solution, My Lord.

Question: Rickon, isn't it?
Answer: Dickon.

Question: Do you ride for Hornhill today?
Answer: I have an army to mobilize. It won't be long until the fighting starts.

Question: And what side will you be fighting for? You were the only man to defeat Robert Baratheon in battle. Not even Rhaegar Targaryen could --
Answer: It's a long ride back to the reach, Ser Jaime. How may I serve?

Question: It's a long ride back to the reach, Ser Jaime. How may I serve?
Answer: I want you to be my ranking general in the wars to come. I want you to swear allegiance to Cersei and I want you to help her destroy her enemies. All of her enemies.

Question: Including Olenna Tyrell? I'm a Tarley. That name means something. We're not oath breakers. We're not schemers. We don't stab our rivals in the back or cut their throats at weddings. I swore an oath to House Tyrell.
Answer: You swore an oath to the Crown as well, Lord Tarley.

Question: She was a great woman, once. Now she's broken. She wants revenge so badly she brought the Dothraki to our shores. The Dothraki in Westeros for the first time in history. I know you don't like my sister, but you have to make a choice. Do you fight with us or with the foreign savages and eunuchs?
Answer: When the war is won the queen will need a new warden of the south. I can think of no better man than Randyll Tarley.

Question: How long?
Answer: It will be years before it kills you. It could be 10, could be 20.

Question: Your mind? Six months, maybe fewer.
Answer: Pardon, Archmaester. I met Stannis Baratheon's daughter at Castle Black. She had Greyscale as a baby and was cured. Isn't there some way --

Question: Does this look like a baby to you?
Answer: No.

Question: Have you studied the varying rates of Greyscale progression in infants and fully grown men?
Answer: Maester Chrissen discovered Shireen Baratheon's affliction immediately.

Question: Mormont?
Answer: There's no need. I've been dead to them for years.

Question: Have you ever been down here, Your Grace?
Answer: No, I can't say I have. I haven't seen these since Robert had them removed from the Throne Room.

Question: That's very nice to hear. Of course, I can't remember a queen who was better loved than my grand daughter. The common people loved her, the nobles loved her. And what is left of her now? Ashes. Commoners, nobles, they're all just children really. They won't obey you unless they fear you.
Answer: I'm grateful to you, Lady Olenna, for your council. I'm grateful to all of you. But you have chosen to follow me. I will not attack King's Landing. We will not attack King's Landing.

Question: Then how do you mean to take the Iron Throne? By asking nicely?
Answer: We will lay siege to the capital surrounding the city on all sides. Cersei will have the Iron Throne but no food for her army or the people.

Question: And I suppose we're providing the Westerosi?
Answer: You are.

Question: So, your master plan is to use our armies? Forgive me for asking, but why did you bother to bring your own?
Answer: The unsullied will have another objective. For decades House Lannister has been the true power in Westeros. And the seat of that power is Casterly Rock. Grey Worm and the Unsullied will sail for the Rock and take it.

Question: Do I have your support?
Answer: You have mine.

Question: Thank you all. Lady Olenna, may I speak with you alone?
Answer: I realize you're here out of hatred for Cersei and not love for me. But I swear to you she will pay for what she's done and we will bring peace back to Westeros.

Question: Peace. Do you think that's what we had under your father or his father or his? Peace never lasts, my dear. Would you take a bit of advice from an old woman?
Answer: He's a clever man, your Hand. I've known a great many clever men. I've outlived them all. Do you know why? I ignored them. The lords of Westeros are sheep. Are you a sheep? No. You're a dragon. Be a dragon.

Question: He's a clever man, your Hand. I've known a great many clever men. I've outlived them all. Do you know why? I ignored them. The lords of Westeros are sheep. Are you a sheep? No. You're a dragon. Be a dragon.
Answer: Enter.

Question: You leave tomorrow. Were you going to say goodbye?
Answer: I will see you when I return.

Question: Why?
Answer: You know why.

Question: That's what I am? Your weakness?
Answer: When Unsullied are young their masters learn their fears. One boy is scared of dogs. One boy hates high places. One is frightened of the ocean. They make the boy sleep with dogs or climb a cliff. They throw him in the water. If he learns to swim, good. If he drowns, good. Either way, strong Unsullied. But I had no fears. I was never the biggest, never the strongest, but I was bravest always.

Question: What? You don't like the title? What would you call it then?
Answer: Possibly something a bit more poetic?

Question: Possibly something a bit more poetic?
Answer: We're not poets, Tarley.

Question: Oh, you are?
Answer: Yes. Should I tell you how he died? From Greyscale.

Question: Yes. Should I tell you how he died? From Greyscale.
Answer: Oh.

Question: What are you doing?
Answer: You're Jorah Mormont. You're the only son of Jeor Mormont.

Question: What is it?
Answer: Rum. Drink it all, please. I'm afraid this is going to hurt.

Question: Have you ever done this before?
Answer: No. No one else will try, so I'm the best you've got. Have a seat. I'm going to remove the entire layer of infected tissue, then apply a medicinal ointment to the --

Question: Hello, Hot Pie. Sit down. Who's that for?
Answer: Mmm. This is good.

Question: You think so? The secret is browning the butter before making the dough. Most people don't don't do that because it takes up too much time.
Answer: I didn't do that.

Question: You've been making pies?
Answer: One or two.

Question: I can't believe you're here. Did you meet the big lady?
Answer: Big lady?

Question: Big lady?
Answer: The lady knight. I figured she was a knight because she had armor on. She was looking for your sister but I told her about you. Did she ever find you?

Question: The lady knight. I figured she was a knight because she had armor on. She was looking for your sister but I told her about you. Did she ever find you?
Answer: She found me.

Question: What happened to you Ary?
Answer: You got any ale?

Question: You got any ale?
Answer: Where are you heading?

Question: Where are you heading?
Answer: King's Landing.

Question: Why?
Answer: I heard Cersei's queen now.

Question: Why would I go there? The Boltons have it.
Answer: No. The Boltons are dead.

Question: What?
Answer: Jon Snow came down from Castle Black with a Wildling army and won the Battle of the Bastards. He's King in the North now.

Question: Why would I lie about that? He's your brother right?
Answer: Thanks for the pie.

Question: Have you forgotten what happened to our grandfather? The Mad King invited him to King's Landing and roasted him alive.
Answer: I know that.

Question: Whose?
Answer: Yours. You are my sister. You are the only Stark in Winterfell. Until I return, the north is yours.

Question: I was sorry when he died. Your father and I had our differences but he loved Cat very much. So did I. She wasn't fond of you, was she? Well, it appears she vastly underestimated you. Your father and brothers are gone, yet here you stand King in the North. Last best hope against the coming storm.
Answer: You don't belong down here.

Question: Not even thank you? If it weren't for me you'd have been slaughtered at that battlefield. You have many enemies, My King, but I swear to you I'm not one of them. I love Sansa as I loved her mother.
Answer: Touch my sister and I'll kill you myself.

Question: Nymeria?
Answer: Nymeria, it's me, Arya. I'm heading north, girl, back to Winterfell. I'm finally going home. Come with me.

Question: Will you shut up about Momma? Momma, momma.
Answer: Maybe I'll kill you both before we take King's Landing and then I won't have to share.

Question: How can you drink this piss? When we reach Sunspear I'll treat you to a Dornish red, the best in the world. Have you ever been to Dorne?
Answer: A few times. Never stayed long.

Question: A boy in every port?
Answer: A boy, a girl. Depends on the port.

Question: Could we get some more?
Answer: I thought it wasn't for you.

Question: And what will you be, handsome?
Answer: Whatever my queen demands.

Question: Why are you standing all the way over there then? A foreign invasion is under way. It seems like you don't need a protector.
Answer: Stay here.

Question: Where are you from? I can't place the accent.
Answer: I was born on the Island of Naarth.

Question: Does she miss me terribly?
Answer: A sham marriage and unconsummated.

Question: I wondered why you weren't there to meet our guests. You begged us to summon the King in the North. Don't you want to see him again?
Answer: I've done my part. I've brought ice and fire together.

Question: Why?
Answer: Because of mistakes I made. Terrible mistakes. I would only be a distraction if I stayed.

Question: So where will you go?
Answer: Volantis.

Question: Forgive me, Ser Davos. I never did receive a formal education, but I could have sworn the last King in the North was Torren Stark who bent the knee to my ancestor Aegon Targaryen in exchange for his life and the lives of the northmen. Torren Stark swore fealty to House Targaryen in perpetuity. But do I have my facts wrong?
Answer: I wasn't there, Your Grace.

Question: No. Of course not. But still, an oath is an oath. In perpetuity means -- what does perpetuity mean, Lord Tyrion?
Answer: Forever.

Question: Oh. Well, that is unfortunate. You've travelled all this way to break faith with House Targaryen?
Answer: Break faith? Your father burned my grandfather alive. He burned my uncle alive. He would have burned the Seven Kingdoms.

Question: Break faith? Your father burned my grandfather alive. He burned my uncle alive. He would have burned the Seven Kingdoms.
Answer: My father was an evil man. On behalf of House Targaryen I ask your forgiveness for the crimes he committed against your family. And I ask you not to judge a daughter by the sins of her father. Our two houses were allies for centuries. Those were the best centuries the kingdom's ever known. Centuries of peace and prosperity with the Targaryens sitting on the Iron Throne and a Stark serving as Warden of the North. I am the last Targaryen, Jon Snow. Honor the pledge your ancestor made to mine. Bend the knee and I will name you Warden of the North. Together we will save this country from those who would destroy it.

Question: Then why are you here?
Answer: Because I need your help and you need mine.

Question: Did you see three dragons flying overhead when you arrived?
Answer: I did.

Question: And did you see the Dothraki, all of whom have sworn to kill for me?
Answer: They're hard to miss.

Question: But still, I need your help?
Answer: Not to defeat Cersei. You could storm King's Landing tomorrow and the city would fall. Hell, we almost took it and we didn't even have dragons.

Question: But you haven't stormed King's Landing. Why not? The only reason I can see is you don't want to kill thousands of innocent people. It's the fastest way to win the war but you won't do it. Which means at the very least you're better than Cersei.
Answer: Still, that doesn't explain why I need your help.

Question: The dead?
Answer: Is that another figure of speech?

Question: Is that another figure of speech?
Answer: The Army of the Dead is on the march.

Question: The Army of the Dead?
Answer: You don't know me well, My Lord, but do you think I am a liar or a madman?

Question: You don't know me well, My Lord, but do you think I am a liar or a madman?
Answer: No, I don't think you're either of those things.

Question: We fled before Robert's assassins could find us. Robert was your father's best friend, no? I wonder if your father knew his best friend sent assassins to murder a baby girl in her crib. Not that it matters now of course. I spent my life in foreign lands. So many men have tried to kill me. I don't remember all of their names. I have been sold like a brood mare. I have been chained and betrayed, raped and defiled. Do you know what kept me standing through all those years in exile? Faith. Not in any gods. Not in myths and legends. In myself. In Daenerys Targaryen. The world hadn't seen a dragon in centuries until my children were born. The Dothraki hadn't crossed the sea. Any sea.
Answer: They did for me. I was born to rule the Seven Kingdoms. And I will.

Question: And why would I do that?
Answer: I mean no offense, Your Grace, but I don't know you. As far as I can tell your claim to the throne rests entirely on your father's name. And my own father fought to overthrow the Mad King. The lords of the north placed their trust in me to lead them. And I will continue to do so as well as I can.

Question: Am I your prisoner?
Answer: Not yet.

Question: And?
Answer: Two or three ships escaped. The rest sunk our captured. Ellaria and the sand snakes dead or captured. The Greyjoys are dead or captured.

Question: All of them?
Answer: Your sister's dead?

Question: Your sister's dead?
Answer: Euron has her.

Question: You saw him take her? And you got away?
Answer: I couldn't save her. I tried.

Question: I have to be honest, it's making me hard. Did you see little Theon's face right before he jumped overboard?
Answer: Oh no!

Question: There's nothing quite like it, is there? The love of the people. I suppose you wouldn't know.
Answer: This same mob spat at my sister not long ago, and if you turn on us, they'll cheer to see your head mounted on a spike.

Question: Advice?
Answer: Does she like it gentle or rough? A finger in the bum?

Question: Does she like it gentle or rough? A finger in the bum?
Answer: Shhh, shhh, shhh, not now. We'll talk later.

Question: The sound of your scream. I never heard a sound like that. I thought, that's true love. Oberyn looked beautiful that day. He really did. No one moved like him. No one had such skill with a spear. Even Ser Gregor couldn't stop him. If only he hadn't taunted him. He could have walked away and left poor Ser Gregor to die. But that wasn't your lover's way, was it? Now he's burried somewhere. And here Ser Gregor is stronger than ever. That must be difficult for you. When my daughter was taken from me, my only daughter, well, you can't imagine how that feels unless you've lost a child. I fed her at my own breast even though they told me to give her to the wet nurse. I couldn't bear to see her in another woman's arms. I never got to have a mother. But Myrcella did. She was mine and you took her from me. Why did you do that?
Answer: It doesn't matter now.

Question: Do you feel powerful now? I don't sleep very well, not at all really. I lie in bed and I stare at the canopy and imagine ways of killing my enemies. How to destroy Ellaria Sand, the woman who murdered my only daughter. I thought about having Ser Gregor crush your skull the way he did Oberyn's. It would be poetic I suppose but fast. Too fast.
Answer: I thought about having him crush your daughter's skull.

Question: Qyburn, he's the cleverest man I know. Clever enough to learn what poison you used to murder Myrcella. The long goodbye, was that it?
Answer: The Long Farewell.

Question: How long does the poison take?
Answer: Difficult to say. Hours, days, it depends on the subject's constitution.

Question: But death is certain?
Answer: Oh yes, Your Grace, quite certain.

Question: What are you doing? No one can see us like this ?
Answer: I am queen of the Seven Kingdoms. I'll do as I please.

Question: For now. Daenerys Targaryen has three full grown dragons. How well do wooden ships fare against fire breathing dragons?
Answer: Her dragons might not be as invulnerable as some think. Now, let's talk about the Targaryen girl. You want to invest in her? I'm guessing the Iron Bank invested considerable gold in the slave trade. How are you profits now that Daenerys has freed all the slaves?

Question: Her dragons might not be as invulnerable as some think. Now, let's talk about the Targaryen girl. You want to invest in her? I'm guessing the Iron Bank invested considerable gold in the slave trade. How are you profits now that Daenerys has freed all the slaves?
Answer: The slave trade has entered a down turn, it's true.

Question: From what I gather she considers herself more of a revolutionary that a monarch. In your experience how do bankers usually fare with revoltionaries?
Answer: The Lannisters owe the Iron Bank quite a lot of money but Lannisters always pay their debts. Do former slaves or Dothraki or dragons?

Question: The Lannisters owe the Iron Bank quite a lot of money but Lannisters always pay their debts. Do former slaves or Dothraki or dragons?
Answer: Your father's daughter indeed.

Question: You didn't before. Grumpkins and snarks you called them. Do you remember? You said it was all nonsense.
Answer: It was all nonsense. Everybody knew it. But then Mormont saw them and you saw them, and I trust the eyes of an honest man more than I trust what everybody knows.

Question: How do I convince people who don't know me that an enemey they don't believe in is coming to kill them all?
Answer: Good question.

Question: So do you have anything reasonable to ask?
Answer: What do you mean?

Question: What do you mean?
Answer: Maybe you are a northern fool. I'm asking if there's something I can do to help you.

Question: Dragonglass?
Answer: Yes. Volcanic glass, obsidian. He says you have a tremendous amount of it here.

Question: Why are we talking about glass? We just lost two of our allies.
Answer: Which is why I was speaking to Jon Snow, a potential ally.

Question: And what does the King in the North want with Dragonglass?
Answer: Apparently it can be turned into weapons that kill White Walkers and their foot soldiers, or stop them, destroy them. I'm unsure of the nomenclature.

Question: And what do you think of this Army of the Dead and White Walkers and Night Kings?
Answer: I'd very much like to believe that Jon Snow is wrong, but a wise man once said that you should never believe a thing simply because you want to believe it.

Question: Which wise man said this?
Answer: I don't remember.

Question: Are you trying to present your own statements as ancient wisdom?
Answer: I would never do that...to you. The reason I believe Jon Snow is because he's here. All of his advisors would have told him not to come. I would have told him not to come, yet he's here anyway. You don't have to believe him. Let him mine the Dragonglass. If he's wrong it's worthless. You didn't even know it was here. It's nothing to you. Give him something by giving him nothing. Take a step toward a more productive relationship with a possible ally. Keep him occupied while we focus on the task at hand. Casterly Rock.

Question: What was that Ser Davos said about taking a knife in the heart for his people? Did you notice that?
Answer: You must allow them their flights of fancy. It's dreary in the north.

Question: You lost two brothers as well?
Answer: People thought dragons were gone forever but here they are. Perhaps we should all be examining what we think we know.

Question: You've been talking to Tyrion?
Answer: He is my Hand.

Question: So you believe me then about the Night King and the Army of the Dead?
Answer: You better get to work, Jon Snow.

Question: How much do we have?
Answer: 4,000 bushels, My Lady.

Question: What does that mean?
Answer: For the current occupants of the castle it's enough food for a year, perhaps more.

Question: What's the longest winter in the past 100 years?
Answer: I'm not entirely certain. I'll check Maester Llewyn's records. He kept a copy of every raven scroll.

Question: Maester Wolkan, you'll see to it?
Answer: Are they covering those breastplates in leather?

Question: Are they covering those breastplates in leather?
Answer: No, My Lady.

Question: Well, shouldn't they be once the real cold comes?
Answer: They should indeed. Pardon me, My Lady.

Question: You there, why isn't there leather on these?
Answer: Command suits you. The northerns are all facing north worried about the threat beyond the wall.

Question: That the woman who murdered my mother, father and brother is dangerous? Thank you for your wise council.
Answer: One of two things will happen. Either the dead will defeat the living, in which case all our troubles come to an end. Or life will win out. And what then?

Question: One of two things will happen. Either the dead will defeat the living, in which case all our troubles come to an end. Or life will win out. And what then?
Answer: Don't fight in the north or the south. Fight every battle everywhere always in your mind. Everyone is your enemy, everyone is your friend, every possible series of events is happening all at once. Live that way and nothing will surprise you. Everything that happens will be something that you've seen before.

Question: How do you know all of this?
Answer: The three-eyed raven taught me.

Question: Hmm. Does it hurt?
Answer: A bit. Less than before.

Question: The climate? You're free to go, Ser. This chamber is needed for the infectious, which you are no longer.
Answer: Tarley, I'd like to speak with you in my study this evening.

Question: How bad is it?
Answer: I suppose I'll find out this evening.

Question: Where will you go?
Answer: I surrendered to this sickness the moment I first saw it. I knew it would kill me or I'd kill myself before it could. Daenerys Stormborn convinced me otherwise. The only place for me is with her.

Question: Perhaps our paths will cross again?
Answer: I hope they do.

Question: You treated him?
Answer: Yes.

Question: Who told you to treat him?
Answer: No one.

Question: Who forbade you or anyone to attempt to treat him?
Answer: I seem to remember you.

Question: But you treated him anyway?
Answer: I did.

Question: I forbade it because it's dangerous and rarely successful. Especially on someone of that age. You could have infected yourself and others. You could have devastated the entire Citadel. But you didn't. It's a meticulous, difficult procedure. Many maesters whose chains are heavy with healing links have attempted it and failed. But you succeeded. How?
Answer: I read the books and followed the instructions.

Question: You were expecting a reward? Your reward is not being immediately expelled from the Citadel. You'd better get started. Be mindful of the paper mites. They like flesh as well.
Answer: We need to find Euron Greyjoy's fleet and sink it.

Question: I wouldn't be alone. I'd have Drogon, Vicerion and Rhaegal. What can anyone do to them?
Answer: They can still do something to you. It only takes one arrow.

Question: What about Casterly Rock?
Answer: The Unsullied will be there soon.

Question: And what will they face?
Answer: A difficult situation. They know we're coming.

Question: Where are they? Where are the rest of the Lannisters?
Answer: It's done?

Question: It's done?
Answer: It is.

Question: And now the rains weep for our whores. Did we fight well?
Answer: I suppose as well as can be expected.

Question: So you'll just let them take it?
Answer: For now. They won't be able to hold it. Euron Greyjoy's navy burned their ships, we emptied the larders before we left. Eventually they'll be forced to abandon their position and march all the way across Westeros.

Question: And you took your army, your real army, and went where they weren't?
Answer: As Robb Stark did to me at Whispering Wood. There are always lessons in failures.

Question: If he was so clever why didn't he take Highgarden the moment your gold mines ran dry? I suppose I'll be able to ask him myself soon enough. No more learning from my mistakes, eh? How will you do it? With that sword?
Answer: That was Joffrey's sword, wasn't it? Not that he ever used it. What did he call it?

Question: That was Joffrey's sword, wasn't it? Not that he ever used it. What did he call it?
Answer: Widow's Wail.

Question: He really was a cunt, wasn't he? I did unspeakable things to protect my family, or watched them being done on my orders. I never lost a night's sleep over them. They were necessary. And whatever I imagined necessary for the safety of House Tyrell I did. But your sister has done things I wasn't capable of imagining. That was my prize mistake, a failure of imagination. She's a monster, you do know that?
Answer: To you, sure. To others as well. But after we've won and there's no one left to oppose us, the people living peaceful in the world she built, do you really think they'll wring their hands over the way she built it?

Question: To you, sure. To others as well. But after we've won and there's no one left to oppose us, the people living peaceful in the world she built, do you really think they'll wring their hands over the way she built it?
Answer: You love her. You really do love her. You poor fool. She'll be the end of you.

Question: Possibly. Not much to be gained from discussing it with you though, is there?
Answer: What better person to discuss it with? What better guarantee could you have that the things you say will never leave this room? But perhaps you're right. If she's driven you this far it's gone beyond your control.

Question: What better person to discuss it with? What better guarantee could you have that the things you say will never leave this room? But perhaps you're right. If she's driven you this far it's gone beyond your control.
Answer: Yes, it has.

Question: How will it happen?
Answer: Cersei had several ideas. Whipping you through the streets and beheading you in front of the Red Keep. Flaying you alive and hanging you from the walls of King's Landing. I talked her out of those.

Question: Will there be pain?
Answer: No. I made sure of that.

Question: You just won the biggest prize in the world. What could you possibly have to be upset about? Come on. You can tell me. Queen of Thorns give you one last prick in the balls before saying goodbye?
Answer: I'll save my confessions for the High Septon.

Question: No, there isn't, is there?
Answer: There is still the question of my prize.

Question: How about that one? It's available.
Answer: You don't want Highgarden.

Question: Oh, is that why you're so fucking glum, eh? All your new riches weighing you down?
Answer: pounds on the back of the carriage and the horses start trotting.

Question: Like what?
Answer: TARLEY and his son DICKON come riding up on horseback. RANDYLL addresses JAIME.

Question: The current harvest?
Answer: We have teams of men collecting it and more farmers in the Reach.

Question: Ser Bronn, will you accompany the Tarleys and help them accelerate this process?
Answer: I'm not much for shoveling weight.

Question: I see a great deal of potential in that venture. I imagine that it would require outside investment?
Answer: It will indeed. I need to expand my armies, my navies. My hand, Qyburn, had made overtures to the Golden Company in Essos.

Question: Do you know who this belonged to?
Answer: No. That very question was what started the War of the Five Kings. In a way, that dagger made you what you are today. Forced from your home, driven out to the wilds beyond the Wall. I imagine you've seen things most men wouldn't believe.

Question: What's that?
Answer: Maester Wolkan built it for me so I can move around more easily.

Question: You're leaving?
Answer: I don't want to leave you, but when they come I need to be with my family. And you're safe, safe as anyone can be now. You don't need me anymore.

Question: That's all you've got to say?
Answer: Thank you.

Question: Thank you?
Answer: For helping me.

Question: Hey, oh. Where are you going?
Answer: In there. I live here.

Question: If Jon Snow is gone who is in charge of Winterfell?
Answer: The Lady of Winterfell, Lady Stark.

Question: Which Lady Stark?
Answer: You tell us. You're the one impersonating her sister.

Question: Do I have to call you Lady Stark now?
Answer: hesitates for a moment.

Question: It suits you, Lady Stark. Jon left you in charge?
Answer: He did. I hope he comes back soon. I remember how happy he was to see me. When he sees you, his heart will probably stop.

Question: They say you killed Joffrey. Did you?
Answer: I wish I had.

Question: Your list?
Answer: Of people I'm going to kill.

Question: How did you get back to Winterfell?
Answer: It's a long story. I imagine yours is too.

Question: You saw me?
Answer: I see quite a lot now.

Question: Why would you go back there?
Answer: Cersei is on her list of names.

Question: Who else is on your list?
Answer: Most of them are dead already.

Question: Where did you get this?
Answer: Littlefinger gave it to me.

Question: Littlefinger, he's here?
Answer: turns to look at SANSA.

Question: Why would he give you a dagger?
Answer: He thought I'd want it.

Question: Why?
Answer: Because it was meant to kill me.

Question: The cutthroat after your fall?
Answer: Why would a cutthroat have a Valyrian steel dagger?

Question: Why would a cutthroat have a Valyrian steel dagger?
Answer: Someone very wealthy wanted me dead.

Question: What do you mean it doesn't matter?
Answer: I don't want it.

Question: Are you sure? It's Valyrian steel.
Answer: It's wasted on a cripple.

Question: What happened?
Answer: begins smirking.

Question: Many things?
Answer: Your Grace.

Question: When?
Answer: A very long time ago.

Question: Doing what? Fighting each other?
Answer: takes DAENERYS by the arm and swings her torch to another part of the wall. There is a mural of the Night King and White Walkers.

Question: And you say you can't defeat them without my armies and my dragons?
Answer: No, I don't think I can.

Question: They will if their king does. They chose you to lead them. They chose you to protect them. Isn't their survival more important than your pride?
Answer: and DAENERYS, DAVOS and MISSANDEI are walking out of the cave. As they exit TYRION and VARYS are standing on the beach awaiting them. DAENERYS begins addressing Tyrion.

Question: What is it?
Answer: We took Casterly Rock.

Question: Isn't it?
Answer: You'll want to discuss this amongst yourselves. Perhaps --

Question: The right plan? Your strategy has lost us Dorne, the Iron Islands and the Reach.
Answer: If I've underestimated our enemies --

Question: Our enemies? Your family, you mean. Perhaps you don't want to hurt them after all.
Answer: begins looking out to the ocean. Three dragons are flying in the sky over the water.

Question: My enemies are in the Red Keep. What kind of a queen am I if I'm not willing to risk my life to fight them?
Answer: A smart one.

Question: What do you think I should do?
Answer: I would never presume to --

Question: You swore to serve both of my mother's daughters, didn't you?
Answer: nods her head in agreement.

Question: Who taught you to do that?
Answer: No one.

Question: What do you think of her?
Answer: Who?

Question: Who?
Answer: sighs

Question: A good heart? I've noticed you starring at that good heart.
Answer: There's no time for that. I saw the Night King, Davos. I looked into his eyes. How many men do we have in the north to fight him? 10,000? Less?

Question: There's no time for that. I saw the Night King, Davos. I looked into his eyes. How many men do we have in the north to fight him? 10,000? Less?
Answer: Fewer.

Question: What?
Answer: and JON near the end of the path. MISSANDEI is standing along the path looking at the ocean.

Question: King Snow, isn't it? No? That doesn't sound right. King Jon?
Answer: It doesn't matter.

Question: Forgive me, but may I ask a question?
Answer: Of course.

Question: Your name is Jon Snow, but your father's name was Ned Stark?
Answer: I'm a bastard. My mother and father weren't married.

Question: Is the custom different in Naarth?
Answer: We don't have marriage in Naarth so the concept of a bastard doesn't exist.

Question: Why did you leave your homeland?
Answer: I was stolen away by slavers.

Question: If I may, how did a slave girl come to advise Daenerys Targaryen?
Answer: She bought me from my master and set me free.

Question: That was good of her. Of course you're serving her now, aren't you?
Answer: I serve my queen because I want to serve my queen. Because I believe in her.

Question: You believe that?
Answer: I know it. All of us who came with her from Essos, we believe in her. She's not our queen because she's the daughter of some king we never knew. She's the queen we chose.

Question: Is that a Greyjoy ship?
Answer: GREYJOY and other Iron Born are pulling their landing boat onto the beach wading through the surf. They pull the boat onto the sand. JON SNOW, MISSANDEI, DAVOS and Dothraki guards are waiting to meet them. JON sees THEON and both men freeze and stare at each other. JON steps forward towards THEON.

Question: Sansa, is she all right?
Answer: grabs THEON by his shirt and pulls him face to face.

Question: Your sister?
Answer: Euron has her. I came to ask the queen to help get her back.

Question: Where did she go?
Answer: All of the gold is safely through the gates of King's Landing.

Question: I hear you fought bravely at Highgarden. Your first battle?
Answer: nods his head in agreement.

Question: And?
Answer: It was glorious.

Question: Men shit themselves when they die. Didn't they teach you that at fancy lad school?
Answer: looks over at BRONN

Question: What?
Answer: Listen.

Question: Where are you?
Answer: walks to the edge of the battlefield accompanied by Dothraki guards. He can see Lannisters being slaughtered. One of the Dothraki guards begin to speak.

Question: What the fuck were you doing back there?
Answer: Ending the war by killing her.

Question: You saw the dragon between you and her?
Answer: looks incredulously at JAIME.

Question: And?
Answer: sits up and says nothing to BRONN. BRONN sits up and faces JAIME.

Question: Don't you mean we're fucked?
Answer: No, I do not. Dragons are where our partnership ends. I'm not going to be around when those things start spitting fire on King's Landing.

Question: You will not kneel?
Answer: I already have a queen.

Question: Who are you?
Answer: A stupid boy.

Question: How many men did we lose?
Answer: We haven't done a full counting.

Question: So what do we do? Sue for peace? I sit on her father's throne, the father you betrayed and murdered. And in her mind she's winning. What sort of offer do you think she'd make?
Answer: turns and walks away from JAIME.

Question: And this was before or after she drank the poison you so kindly provided her?
Answer: After.

Question: And you believed her?
Answer: If you were Olenna would you rather have seen your granddaughter married to Joffrey or Tommen? Which one would Margerey been better able to control? Which one would have made Olenna the true ruler of the Seven Kingdoms? She was telling the truth.

Question: If you were Olenna would you rather have seen your granddaughter married to Joffrey or Tommen? Which one would Margerey been better able to control? Which one would have made Olenna the true ruler of the Seven Kingdoms? She was telling the truth.
Answer: looks away, then sits down.

Question: They're beautiful, aren't they?
Answer: That wasn't the word I was thinking of, but, yes, they are. Gorgeous beasts.

Question: And?
Answer: And I have fewer enemies today than I did yesterday.

Question: You're not sure how you feel about that?
Answer: No, I'm not.

Question: How many men did your army kill taking Winterfell back from the Boltons?
Answer: Thousands.

Question: So it was a figure of speech?
Answer: doesn't say anything. A group of Dothraki guards approach DAENERYS and speak in their native tongue.

Question: You look strong. You found a cure?
Answer: I wouldn't be here if I hadn't. I return to your service, my queen, if you'll have me.

Question: Do you know him?
