Question: And the Kingslayer?
Answer: You enjoy risking your neck, don't you?

Question: You enjoy risking your neck, don't you?
Answer: Life is boring.

Question: Do I please the queen?
Answer: You might be the most arrogant man I've ever met. I like that.

Question: A proposal is what I'm proposing. On the off chance that we survive the Night King, what if the Seven Kingdoms, for once in their whole shit history, were ruled by a just woman and an honorable man?
Answer: They do make a handsome couple.

Question: What is that?
Answer: Nothing lasts.

Question: How many today?
Answer: Only eighteen goats and eleven sheep.

Question: What's the matter?
Answer: The dragons are barely eating.

Question: What's wrong with them?
Answer: They don't like the North.

Question: What if he doesn't want me to?
Answer: Then I've enjoyed your company, Jon Snow.

Question: What do I hold onto?
Answer: Whatever you can.

Question: Gendry?
Answer: He's here.

Question: You're saying you're good, is that it?
Answer: I'm just saying it's a tricky material to-

Question: You know who makes weapons for the wildlings? Cripples and cocksuckers. Which one are you?
Answer: Leave him be.

Question: You're a cold little bitch, aren't you? Guess that's why you're still alive.
Answer: That was a nice ax you made for him. You've gotten better.

Question: Is that a command, Lady Stark?
Answer: Don't call me that.

Question: Can you make it?
Answer: What do you need something like this for?

Question: What do you need something like this for?
Answer: Can you make it or not?

Question: Can you make it or not?
Answer: You already have a sword. What's that?

Question: You already have a sword. What's that?
Answer: It's Valyrian steel. I always knew you were just another rich girl.

Question: House Glover will stand behind House Stark as we have for a thousand years." Isn't that what he said?
Answer: I will stand behind Jon Snow," he said.

Question: Do you think we can beat the Army of the Dead without her? I fought them, Sansa. Twice. You want to worry about who holds what title, I'm telling you it doesn't matter. Without her, we don't stand a chance.
Answer: Do you have any faith in me at all?

Question: Do you have any faith in me at all?
Answer: You know I do.

Question: Did you bend the knee to save the North or because you love her?
Answer: Oh!

Question: So you're the man?
Answer: Um. Which man am I, Your Grace?

Question: Um. Which man am I, Your Grace?
Answer: The one who saved Ser Jorah when no one else could.

Question: For what crime?
Answer: Um, I borrowed a few books from the Citadel.

Question: From the Citadel?
Answer: From my family. It's been in House Tarly for generations.

Question: Not Randyll Tarly?
Answer: You know him?

Question: You know him?
Answer: I offered to let him retain his lands and titles if he bent the knee. He refused.

Question: Hm. Thank you, Your Grace. For telling me. And m- may I?
Answer: Of course.

Question: What are you doing out here?
Answer: Waiting, for an old friend. It's time to tell Jon the truth.

Question: No, no. You're his brother. Shouldn't you tell him?
Answer: I'm not his brother. He trusts you more than anyone. Now's the time.

Question: Sam?
Answer: I'm sorry, I know I'm not supposed to be down here.

Question: Were you hiding from me?
Answer: Of course not.

Question: What are you doing in Winterfell? Or did you read every book in the Citadel already?
Answer: What's wrong? Gilly? Is she all right?

Question: What's wrong? Gilly? Is she all right?
Answer: She's good.

Question: Little Sam?
Answer: Don't you know?

Question: Don't you know?
Answer: Know what?

Question: Know what?
Answer: Daenerys. She executed my father and brother. They were her prisoners.

Question: Would you have done it?
Answer: Well, I've executed men who disobeyed me.

Question: What are you talking about?
Answer: Your mother was Lyanna Stark.

Question: It's the truth. You gave up your crown to save your people. Would she do the same?
Answer: Stay back, he's got blue eyes!

Question: Did you find anyone?
Answer: The Umber boy.

Question: We"?
Answer: I promised to fight for the living. I intend to keep that promise.

Question: Like you knew your sister?
Answer: He came here alone, knowing full well how he'd be received. Why would he do that if he weren't telling the truth?

Question: He came here alone, knowing full well how he'd be received. Why would he do that if he weren't telling the truth?
Answer: Perhaps he trusts his little brother to defend him, right up to the moment he slits my throat.

Question: Do you want me to apologize? I won't. We were at war. Everything I did, I did for my house and my family. I'd do it all again.
Answer: The things we do for love.

Question: So why have you abandoned your house and family now?
Answer: Because this goes beyond loyalty.

Question: You vouch for him?
Answer: I do.

Question: You would fight beside him?
Answer: I would.

Question: What does the Warden of the North say about it?
Answer: We need every man we can get.

Question: Don't you have something better to do?
Answer: You make my weapon yet?

Question: You make my weapon yet?
Answer: Just as soon as I'm done making a few thousand of these.

Question: Are you going to be down in the crypt?
Answer: No, but-

Question: You've fought them?
Answer: I did. Some of them.

Question: How many?
Answer: A few. That was enough.

Question: What are they like?
Answer: Bad. Really bad.

Question: Really bad"?
Answer: Even a smith's apprentice can do better than "really bad." What do they look like? What do they smell like? How do they move? How hard are they to kill?

Question: Even a smith's apprentice can do better than "really bad." What do they look like? What do they smell like? How do they move? How hard are they to kill?
Answer: Look, I know you want to fight. And I know you're not scared of rapers or murderers or-This is different. This is-this is death. You want to know what they're like? Death. That's what they're like.

Question: Look, I know you want to fight. And I know you're not scared of rapers or murderers or-This is different. This is-this is death. You want to know what they're like? Death. That's what they're like.
Answer: I know Death.

Question: My weapon?
Answer: I'll get right on it.

Question: You're not?
Answer: No. I'm something else now.

Question: Why didn't you tell them?
Answer: You won't be able to help us in this fight if I let them murder you first.

Question: What about afterwards?
Answer: How do you know there is an afterwards?

Question: How do you know there is an afterwards?
Answer: Well, here we are.

Question: How do they feel about their new queen?
Answer: She's your new queen too.

Question: And she is? Different?
Answer: She is.

Question: You're sure about her?
Answer: I am.

Question: Was she lying about the baby too?
Answer: No, that part is real.

Question: What?
Answer: She never fooled you. You always knew exactly what she was, and you loved her anyway.

Question: What are you doing?
Answer: I think you know.

Question: You want me to insult you?
Answer: No!

Question: Have you done something to offend me?
Answer: Many things.

Question: You're advising me to forgive the man who stole your position?
Answer: I am. And one other suggestion, if you'll allow me.

Question: And yet, I can't help but feel we're at odds with one another. Why is that? Your brother.
Answer: He loves you, you know that.

Question: Who was the first?
Answer: Someone taller.

Question: And what happens afterwards? We defeat the dead, we destroy Cersei. What happens then?
Answer: I take the Iron Throne.

Question: What about the North? It was taken from us, and we took it back. And we said we'd never bow to anyone else again. What about the North?
Answer: Apologies, my lady. Your Grace.

Question: What is it?
Answer: My queen.

Question: Your sister?
Answer: She only has a few ships, and she couldn't sail them here. So, she's sailing to the Iron Islands instead, to take them back in your name.

Question: But why aren't you with her?
Answer: I want to fight for Winterfell, Lady Sansa, if you'll have me.

Question: Which way should I go?
Answer: Which way do you want to go?

Question: Which way do you want to go?
Answer: All the children will be going below when the time comes.

Question: How did you find each other?
Answer: We met up at the Last Hearth.

Question: The Umbers?
Answer: Fighting for the Night King now.

Question: How long do we have?
Answer: Before the sun comes up tomorrow.

Question: The big woman still here?
Answer: They're coming.

Question: So, what can we do?
Answer: The Night King made them all. They follow his command. If he falls Getting to him may be our best chance.

Question: Why? What does he want?
Answer: An endless night. He wants to erase this world, and I am its memory.

Question: That's what death is, isn't it? Forgetting. Being forgotten. If we forget where we've been and what we've done, we're not men anymore. Just animals. Your memories don't come from books. Your stories aren't just stories. If I wanted to erase the world of men, I'd start with you.
Answer: How will he find you?

Question: How will he find you?
Answer: His mark is on me.

Question: You want us to use you as bait?
Answer: We're not leaving you alone out there.

Question: Dragonfire will stop him?
Answer: I don't know. No one's ever tried.

Question: Do you need help?
Answer: No.

Question: When Daenerys takes her throne there will be no place for us here. I am loyal to my queen. I will fight for her until her enemies are defeated, but when the war is over and she has won, do you want to grow old in this place? Is there nothing else you want to do, nothing else you want to see?
Answer: Naath. I'd like to see the beaches again.

Question: Have you told her yet?
Answer: No.

Question: Gilly? Little Sam?
Answer: They'll be safe down in the crypt.

Question: Do you miss it?
Answer: Of course I miss it.

Question: To contemplate your imminent death. You've come to the right place. You want some of this piss? It's not bad. It's not good either.
Answer: Thank you, milord.

Question: And you?
Answer: No, thank you. I should try and get some sleep.

Question: You really think any of us are going to sleep tonight? Join us.
Answer: All right. Just a bit.

Question: Well, what do we have here?
Answer: Ser Davos, join us.

Question: Would you like a drink?
Answer: Brought my own.

Question: They call me "Giantsbane." Want to know why?
Answer: I killed a giant when I was ten. Then I climbed right into bed with his wife.

Question: When she woke up, you know what she did? Suckled me at her teat for three months. Thought I was her baby. That's how I got so strong. Giant's milk.
Answer: Maybe I will have that drink.

Question: What are you doing up here?
Answer: What's it look like?

Question: What's it look like?
Answer: No, I mean, what are you doing up here? You joined the Brotherhood. You went beyond the Wall with Jon. You're here now. Why? When was the last time you fought for anyone but yourself?

Question: No, I mean, what are you doing up here? You joined the Brotherhood. You went beyond the Wall with Jon. You're here now. Why? When was the last time you fought for anyone but yourself?
Answer: I fought for you, didn't I?

Question: I fought for you, didn't I?
Answer: Oh, for fuck's sake. May as well be at a bloody wedding.

Question: Was he on your list?
Answer: For a little while.

Question: Where are you going?
Answer: I'm not spending my final hours with you two miserable old shits.

Question: That for me?
Answer: This'll work.

Question: What did the Red Woman want with you?
Answer: She wanted my blood for some kind of spell.

Question: Why your blood?
Answer: I'm Robert Baratheon's bastard.

Question: Was that your first time?
Answer: No, yeah, I've never had leeches put all over my cock.

Question: What? I-I didn't-I wasn't with her.
Answer: Were you with other girls before that in King's Landing?

Question: Were you with other girls before that in King's Landing?
Answer: Or after?

Question: Or after?
Answer: You don't remember?

Question: You don't remember?
Answer: Yes, I was.

Question: One? Two? Twenty?
Answer: Well, I didn't keep count.

Question: It's strange, isn't it? Almost everyone here's fought the Starks at one time or another. And here we are in their castle, ready to defend it. Together.
Answer: At least we'll die with honor.

Question: I-I do. How many battles have we survived between us? Ser Davos Seaworth. Survivor of both the Blackwater and the Battle of the Bastards.
Answer: All without a shred of combat ability.

Question: She's not a ser? You're not a knight?
Answer: Women can't be knights.

Question: Why not?
Answer: Tradition.

Question: Do you want to be a knight or not? Kneel.
Answer: In the name of the Warrior, I charge you to be brave.

Question: What have you got there?
Answer: It's called Heartsbane. It's my family sword.

Question: How about a song? One of you must know one. Ser Davos?
Answer: You'll pray for a quick death.

Question: Ser Brienne?
Answer: Mm-mm.

Question: Who's that?
Answer: Lyanna Stark.

Question: Who told you this?
Answer: Bran. He saw it.

Question: He saw it?
Answer: And Samwell confirmed it. He read about their marriage at the Citadel without even knowing what it meant.

Question: A secret no one in the world knew except your brother and your best friend. Doesn't seem strange to you?
Answer: It's true, Dany. I know it is.

Question: Do you speak their tongue?
Answer: Tell them to lift their swords.

Question: What? Remember the Battle of Blackwater? I brought us through the Mud Gate.
Answer: And got your face cut in half.

Question: Why not?
Answer: The Dragon Queen. Your divided loyalties would become a problem.

Question: Go where?
Answer: Man the walls!

Question: Fuck off! We can't beat them. Don't you see that, you stupid whore? We're fighting Death! They can't beat Death.
Answer: Tell her that.

Question: What do we say to the God of Death?
Answer: Not today.

Question: Have you seen Arya?
Answer: You can still smell the burning bodies, and that's where your head is at.

Question: Of course it's about that, you twat. Why shouldn't it be? The dead are dead. You're not.
Answer: Gendry.

Question: That's right, isn't it?
Answer: Yes, Your Grace.

Question: You are aware he took my family's throne and tried to have me murdered?
Answer: I didn't even know he was my father until after he was dead.

Question: Yes, he's dead. His brothers are too. So who's Lord of Storm's End now?
Answer: I don't know, Your Grace.

Question: Does anyone?
Answer: I think you should be Lord of Storm's End.

Question: That's easy, isn't it?
Answer: A fitting reward for a hero.

Question: See? You're not the only one who's clever.
Answer: I have to go down and get another barrel.

Question: We fought dead things and lived to talk about it. If this isn't the time to drink, when is?
Answer: The last time I saw her, I told her I'd kill her if I ever saw her again.

Question: So did you?
Answer: Never got the chance. She did it to herself. Or her god did it to her. Lord of Light. We play his game for him, we fight his war and win, and then he fucks off. No signs, no blessings. Who knows what he wants?

Question: Never got the chance. She did it to herself. Or her god did it to her. Lord of Light. We play his game for him, we fight his war and win, and then he fucks off. No signs, no blessings. Who knows what he wants?
Answer: I don't imagine thinking about that subject will leave you any happier than before.

Question: And what if I'm not trying to be happy?
Answer: Then you're in luck. We may have defeated them, but we still have us to contend with.

Question: And?
Answer: Nothing?

Question: Nothing?
Answer: She won't eat.

Question: Who?
Answer: Her soldiers.

Question: What have I told you, Martha?
Answer: The greater the risk, the greater the reward.

Question: The Northern armies?
Answer: Just crossed the Trident. They'll be at the walls of King's Landing in two days. How is she?

Question: Just crossed the Trident. They'll be at the walls of King's Landing in two days. How is she?
Answer: She hasn't seen anyone since we returned. Hasn't left her chambers, hasn't accepted any food.

Question: Aren't you worried for her?
Answer: I'm worried for all of us. They say every time a Targaryen is born, the gods toss a coin and the world holds its breath.

Question: What do you want?
Answer: All I've ever wanted. The right ruler on the Iron Throne. I still don't know how her coin has landed. But I'm quite certain about yours.

Question: Your Grace?
Answer: There's something you need to know.

Question: And Varys?
Answer: Your Master of Whisperers needs to be aware too.

Question: Why do you think Sansa told you? What do you think she hoped to gain?
Answer: She trusts me.

Question: What did I say would happen if you told your sister?
Answer: I don't want it, and that's what I told him.

Question: Is that all I am to you? Your queen?
Answer: All right, then.

Question: They are. In a tyrant's grip. Whose fault is that? Mine?
Answer: What does it matter whose fault it is? Thousands of children will die if the city burns.

Question: What does it matter whose fault it is? Thousands of children will die if the city burns.
Answer: Your sister knows how to use her enemies' weaknesses against them. That's what she thinks our mercy is - weakness.

Question: Davos. I need to ask you a favor. You're the greatest smuggler alive, aren't you?
Answer: I'm not gonna like this favor, am I?

Question: I'm not gonna like this favor, am I?
Answer: He's always better when he's got some food in him.

Question: Problem is when he's got drink in him. See what he did the other week?
Answer: Aye. Fighting as well. Commander nearly caught him.

Question: Ay up. Where you going?
Answer: I'm Arya Stark. I'm going to kill Queen Cersei.

Question: Where's he going?
Answer: I drink to eat the skull keeper.

Question: Ordered by whom? The queen herself?
Answer: No.

Question: How did they find you?
Answer: Did you consider taking it off?

Question: Did you consider taking it off?
Answer: Cersei once called me "the stupidest Lannister."

Question: When have I ever been able to convince Cersei of anything?
Answer: Try. If not for yourself, if not for her, then for every one of the million people in that city, innocent or otherwise.

Question: Why?
Answer: Escape. The two of you, together. Remember where we met, where they keep the dragon skulls, beneath the Red Keep? Take her down there. Keep following the stairways down, down as far as they'll go. You'll come out onto a beach at the foot of the keep. A dinghy will be waiting for you. Sail out of the bay. If the winds are kind, you'll make it to Pentos. Start a new life.

Question: Escape. The two of you, together. Remember where we met, where they keep the dragon skulls, beneath the Red Keep? Take her down there. Keep following the stairways down, down as far as they'll go. You'll come out onto a beach at the foot of the keep. A dinghy will be waiting for you. Sail out of the bay. If the winds are kind, you'll make it to Pentos. Start a new life.
Answer: Sail right past the Iron Fleet and into a new life? Sounds a lot less likely than Cersei winning this war-

Question: Sail right past the Iron Fleet and into a new life? Sounds a lot less likely than Cersei winning this war-
Answer: There won't be an Iron Fleet for much longer. Do it. If you don't, you'll never see Cersei again.

Question: You think you wanted revenge a long time? I've been after it all my life.
Answer: It's all I care about. And look at me.

Question: Look at me! You wanna be like me?
Answer: You come with me, you die here.

Question: Alanna! Alanna! Have you seen my wife? Have you seen my wife?
Answer: Let go.

Question: Have you seen my wife?
Answer: Out of the way!

Question: How much more defeated do you want them to be? They're on their knees.
Answer: They are breathing.

Question: And what are the queen's commands?
Answer: Kill all who follow Cersei Lannister." These are free men. They chose to fight for her.

Question: Will you break the wheel with me?
Answer: You freed your brother. You committed treason.

Question: What are you doing here?
Answer: Hey, what happened?

Question: Hey, what happened?
Answer: I came to kill Cersei. Your queen got there first.

Question: Did you bring any wine?
Answer: No.

Question: So is there life after death?
Answer: Not that I've seen.

Question: Is it? When you heard her talking to her soldiers, did she sound like someone who's done fighting?
Answer: She liberated the people of Slaver's Bay. She liberated the people of King's Landing. And she'll go on liberating until the people of the world are free and she rules them all.

Question: You think our house words are stamped on our bodies when we're born and that's who we are? Then I'd be fire and blood too. She's not her father, no more than you're Tywin Lannister.
Answer: My father was an evil man. My sister was an evil woman. Pile up all the bodies of all the people they ever killed, there still won't be half as many as our beautiful queen slaughtered in a single day.

Question: Would you have done it?
Answer: What?

Question: What?
Answer: You've been up there, on a dragon's back. You've had that power. Would you have burned the city down?

Question: You've been up there, on a dragon's back. You've had that power. Would you have burned the city down?
Answer: I don't know.

Question: What's it matter what I'd do?
Answer: It matters more than anything. When she murdered the slavers of Astapor, I'm sure no one but the slavers complained. After all, they were evil men.

Question: When she crucified hundreds of Meereenese nobles, who could argue? They were evil men. The Dothraki khals she burned alive? They would have done worse to her. Everywhere she goes, evil men die and we cheer her for it. And she grows more powerful and more sure that she is good and right. She believes her destiny is to build a better world for everyone. If you believed that if you truly believed it, wouldn't you kill whoever stood between you and paradise?
Answer: I know you love her. I love her too. Not as successfully as you. But I believed in her with all my heart. Love is more powerful than reason. We all know that. Look at my brother.

Question: You just came up with that?
Answer: Maester Aemon said it a long time ago.

Question: Sometimes duty is the death of love. You are the shield that guards the realms of men. And you've always tried to do the right thing. No matter the cost, you've tried to protect people. Who is the greatest threat to the people now?
Answer: It's a terrible thing I'm asking. It's also the right thing. Do you think I'm the last man she'll execute? Who is more dangerous than the rightful heir to the Iron Throne?

Question: It's a terrible thing I'm asking. It's also the right thing. Do you think I'm the last man she'll execute? Who is more dangerous than the rightful heir to the Iron Throne?
Answer: That's her decision. She is the queen.

Question: And your sisters? Do you see them bending the knee?
Answer: My sisters will be loyal to the throne.

Question: Why do you think Sansa told me the truth about you? Because she doesn't want Dany to be queen.
Answer: She doesn't get to choose.

Question: When I was a girl, my brother told me it was made with a thousand swords from Aegon's fallen enemies. What do a thousand swords look like in the mind of a little girl who can't count to twenty? I imagined a mountain of swords too high to climb. So many fallen enemies, you could only see the soles of Aegon's feet.
Answer: I saw them executing Lannister prisoners in the street. They said they were acting on your orders.

Question: Necessary? Have you been down there? Have you seen? Children, little children, burned!
Answer: I tried to make peace with Cersei. She used their innocence as a weapon against me. She thought it would cripple me.

Question: And Tyrion?
Answer: He conspired behind my back with my enemies. How have you treated people who've done the same to you, even when it broke your heart?

Question: He conspired behind my back with my enemies. How have you treated people who've done the same to you, even when it broke your heart?
Answer: Forgive him.

Question: How do you know? How do you know it'll be good?
Answer: Because I know what is good. And so do you.

Question: What about everyone else? All the other people who think they know what's good.
Answer: They don't get to choose.

Question: Where's Jon?
Answer: He is our prisoner.

Question: Friends, please. We've been cutting each other's throats long enough. Torgo Nudho. Am I saying that properly?
Answer: If it weren't for you and your men, we wouldo ve lost the war with the dead. This country owes you a debt it can never repay, but let us try. There is land in the Reach. Good land. The people that used to live there are gone. Make it your own. Start your own house with the Unsullied as your bannermen. We've had enough war. Thousands of you, thousands of them. You know how it ends. We need to find a better way.

Question: Uncle? Please sit.
Answer: Well, we have to choose someone.

Question: Why just us?
Answer: Um- We represent all the great houses, but whomever we choose, they won't just rule over lords and ladies. Maybe the decision about what's best for everyone should be left to well, everyone.

Question: Me? The Imp?
Answer: Half the people hate me for serving Daenerys, the other half hate me for betraying her.

Question: Who, then?
Answer: I've had nothing to do but think these past few weeks. About our bloody history. About the mistakes we've made.

Question: What unites people? Armies? Gold? Flags? Stories. There's nothing in the world more powerful than a good story. Nothing can stop it. No enemy can defeat it. And who has a better story than Bran the Broken? The boy who fell from a high tower and lived. He knew he'd never walk again, so he learned to fly. He crossed beyond the Wall, a crippled boy, and became the Three-Eyed Raven. He is our memory, the keeper of all our stories. The wars, weddings, births, massacres, famines. Our triumphs... mm, our defeats, our past. Who better to lead us into the future?
Answer: Bran has no interest in ruling and he can't father children.

Question: I know you don't want it. I know you don't care about power. But I ask you now, if we choose you will you wear the crown? Will you lead the Seven Kingdoms to the best of your abilities from this day until your last day?
Answer: Why do you think I came all this way?

Question: Why do you think I came all this way?
Answer: To Brandon of House Stark... I say aye.

Question: There's still a Night's Watch?
Answer: The world will always need a home for bastards and broken men.

Question: Was it right? What I did?
Answer: What we did.

Question: I wish there had been another way. Can you forgive me?
Answer: The North is free, thanks to you.

Question: You think anyone will dare tell you women aren't allowed?
Answer: I'm not going back north.

Question: Where are you going?
Answer: What's west of Westeros?

Question: What's west of Westeros?
Answer: No one knows. It's where all the maps stop. That's where I'm going.

Question: You have your Needle?
Answer: Right here.

Question: What's this?
Answer: A Song of Ice and Fire. Archmaester Ebrose's history of the wars following the death of King Robert. I helped him with the title.

Question: He's not kind?
Answer: He-

Question: He what? What does he say about me?
Answer: I don't believe you're mentioned, ahem.

Question: And Drogon? Any word?
Answer: He was last spotted flying east, toward-

Question: Ser Bronn of the Blackwater, Lord of Highgarden, Lord Paramount of the Reach and Master of Coin, would you say the crown's debt to you has been paid?
Answer: In full, my lord Hand.

Question: Good. Time to start incurring a new one. We have hungry people to feed. Can we expect some assistance in this regard?
Answer: Indeed we can.

Question: You Master of Grammar now too?
Answer: Grandmaester, ahem, it is my theory, based on my years of work on the Casterly Rock sewers, that clean water leads to a healthier population.
